111011.title: Chief Executive
111011.description: Determine and formulate policies and provide overall direction of companies or private and public sector organizations within guidelines set up by a board of directors or similar governing body. Plan, direct, or coordinate operational activities at the highest level of management with the help of subordinate executives and staff managers.
111011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training

111021.title: Operations Manager
111021.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the operations of public or private sector organizations, overseeing multiple departments or locations. Duties and responsibilities include formulating policies, managing daily operations, and planning the use of materials and human resources, but are too diverse and general in nature to be classified in any one functional area of management or administration, such as personnel, purchasing, or administrative services. Usually manage through subordinate supervisors.
111021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
111021.title_ja: オペレーションマネージャー

111031.title: Legislator
111031.description: Develop, introduce, or enact laws and statutes at the local, tribal, state, or federal level. Includes only workers in elected positions.
111031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

112011.title: Advertising and Promotion Manager
112011.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate advertising policies and programs or produce collateral materials, such as posters, contests, coupons, or giveaways, to create extra interest in the purchase of a product or service for a department, an entire organization, or on an account basis.
112011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
112011.title_ja: 広告・プロモーションマネージャー

112021.title: Marketing Manager
112021.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate marketing policies and programs, such as determining the demand for products and services offered by a firm and its competitors, and identify potential customers. Develop pricing strategies with the goal of maximizing the firm’s profits or share of the market while ensuring the firm’s customers are satisfied. Oversee product development or monitor trends that indicate the need for new products and services.
112021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
112021.title_ja: マーケティングマネージャー

112022.title: Sales Manager
112022.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the actual distribution or movement of a product or service to the customer. Coordinate sales distribution by establishing sales territories, quotas, and goals and establish training programs for sales representatives. Analyze sales statistics gathered by staff to determine sales potential and inventory requirements and monitor the preferences of customers.
112022.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

112032.title: Public Relations Manager
112032.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate activities designed to create or maintain a favorable public image or raise issue awareness for their organization or client.
112032.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
112032.title_ja: 広報担当マネージャー

112033.title: Fundraising Manager
112033.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate activities to solicit and maintain funds for special projects or nonprofit organizations.
112033.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
112033.title_ja: ファンドレイジング・マネージャー

113012.title: Administrative Services Manager
113012.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate one or more administrative services of an organization, such as records and information management, mail distribution, and other office support services. Medical records administrators are included in “Medical and Health Services Managers”.
113012.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
113012.title_ja: 管理サービスマネージャー

113013.title: Facilities Manager
113013.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate operations and functionalities of facilities and buildings. May include surrounding grounds or multiple facilities of an organization’s campus.
113013.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
113013.title_ja: ファシリティマネージャー

113021.title: Computer and Information Systems Manager
113021.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate activities in such fields as electronic data processing, information systems, systems analysis, and computer programming.
113021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
113021.title_es: Gerente de Sistemas de Computación e Información
113021.title_zh: 计算机和信息系统经理
113021.title_ja: コンピュータと情報システムマネージャ
113021.title_tl: Manager ng Computer at Impormasyon ng Sistema

113031.title: Financial Manager
113031.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate accounting, investing, banking, insurance, securities, and other financial activities of a branch, office, or department of an establishment.
113031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
113031.title_ja: ファイナンシャルマネージャー

113051.title: Industrial Production Manager
113051.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the work activities and resources necessary for manufacturing products in accordance with cost, quality, and quantity specifications.
113051.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
113051.title_ja: 工業生産マネージャー

113061.title: Purchasing Manager
113061.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the activities of buyers, purchasing officers, and related workers involved in purchasing materials, products, and services. Includes wholesale or retail trade merchandising managers and procurement managers.
113061.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
113061.title_ja: 購買担当マネージャー

113071.title: Transportation, Storage, and Distribution Manager
113071.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate transportation, storage, or distribution activities in accordance with organizational policies and applicable government laws or regulations. Includes logistics managers.
113071.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
113071.title_es: Gerente de Transporte, Almacenamiento, y Distribución
113071.title_ja: 輸送、保管、流通マネージャ

113111.title: Compensation and Benefits Manager
113111.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate compensation and benefits activities of an organization. Job analysis and position description managers are included in “Human Resources Managers”.
113111.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
113111.title_ja: 報酬および福利厚生マネージャー

113121.title: Human Resources Manager
113121.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate human resources activities and staff of an organization.
113121.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training

113131.title: Training and Development Manager
113131.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the training and development activities and staff of an organization.
113131.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
113131.title_ja: トレーニング&デベロップメントマネージャー

119013.title: Farm, Ranch, and Agricultural Manager
119013.official_title: Farmers, Ranchers, and Other Agricultural Managers
119013.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the management or operation of farms, ranches, greenhouses, aquacultural operations, nurseries, timber tracts, or other agricultural establishments. May hire, train, and supervise farm workers or contract for services to carry out the day-to-day activities of the managed operation. May engage in or supervise planting, cultivating, harvesting, and financial and marketing activities.
119013.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
119013.title_es: Gerente de Establecimientos Agrícolas, Ganaderos, y de Otras Actividades Agrícolas
119013.title_ja: 農場、牧場、農業マネージャー
119013.title_tl: Sakahan, Rantso, at Tagapamahala ng Agrikultura

119021.title: Construction Manager
119021.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate, usually through subordinate supervisory personnel, activities concerned with the construction and maintenance of structures, facilities, and systems. Participate in the conceptual development of a construction project and oversee its organization, scheduling, budgeting, and implementation. Includes managers in specialized construction fields, such as carpentry or plumbing.
119021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
119021.title_ja: コンストラクションマネージャー

119031.title: Preschool and Daycare Administrator
119031.official_title: Education and Childcare Administrators, Preschool and Daycare
119031.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate academic or nonacademic activities of preschools or childcare centers and programs, including before- and after-school care.
119031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
119031.title_es: Administradora/Administrado Educativa(o) Preescolar y de Guardería Infantil
119031.title_ja: 就学前および保育管理者

119032.title: K-12 Education Administrator
119032.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the academic, administrative, or auxiliary activities of kindergarten, elementary, or secondary schools.
119032.typical_training: Master's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
119032.title_es: Administradora/Administrado Educativa(o) de Nivel Primario hasta Secundario

119033.title: Postsecondary Education Administrator
119033.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate student instruction, administration, and services, as well as other research and educational activities, at postsecondary institutions, including universities, colleges, and junior and community colleges.
119033.typical_training: Master's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

119039.title: Education Administrator
119039.description: All education administrators not listed separately.
119039.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

119041.title: Architectural and Engineering Manager
119041.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate activities in such fields as architecture and engineering or research and development in these fields.
119041.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
119041.title_ja: 建築・エンジニアリングマネージャー

119051.title: Food Service Manager
119051.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate activities of an organization or department that serves food and beverages.
119051.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
119051.title_ja: フードサービスマネージャー

119071.title: Gambling Manager
119071.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate gambling operations in a casino. May formulate house rules.
119071.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
119071.title_ja: ギャンブルマネージャー

119072.title: Entertainment and Recreation Manager
119072.official_title: Entertainment and Recreation Managers, Except Gambling
119072.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate entertainment and recreational activities and operations of a recreational facility, including cruise ships and parks.
119072.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
119072.title_ja: エンターテイメント＆レクリエーションマネージャー

119081.title: Lodging Manager
119081.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate activities of an organization or department that provides lodging and other accommodations.
119081.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

119111.title: Medical and Health Services Manager
119111.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate medical and health services in hospitals, clinics, managed care organizations, public health agencies, or similar organizations.
119111.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
119111.title_es: Director de Servicios Médico y de Salud
119111.title_ja: メディカル＆ヘルスサービスマネージャー
119111.title_tl: Tagapamahala ng mga Serbisyong Medikal at

119121.title: Natural Sciences Manager
119121.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate activities in such fields as life sciences, physical sciences, mathematics, statistics, and research and development in these fields.
119121.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training

119131.title: Postmaster or Mail Superintendent
119131.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate operational, administrative, management, and support services of a U.S. post office; or coordinate activities of workers engaged in postal and related work in assigned post office.
119131.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
119131.title_es: Jefe/Jefa de Correo y Superintendentes de Correo
119131.title_ja: 郵便局長または郵便局長

119141.title: Property, Real Estate, and Community Association Manager
119141.official_title: Property, Real Estate, and Community Association Managers
119141.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the selling, buying, leasing, or governance activities of commercial, industrial, or residential real estate properties. Includes managers of homeowner and condominium associations, rented or leased housing units, buildings, or land (including rights-of-way).
119141.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
119141.title_es: Gerente de Propiedad, Inmuebles, y Asociaciones de Vivienda Comunitaria
119141.title_en: Property, Real Estate, and Community Association Manager
119141.title_zh: 房地产、房地产和社区协会经理
119141.title_ja: 不動産、不動産、コミュニティ協会マネージャー
119141.title_tl: Ari-arian, Real Estate, at Komunidad Association Manager

119151.title: Social and Community Service Manager
119151.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the activities of a social service program or community outreach organization. Oversee the program or organization’s budget and policies regarding participant involvement, program requirements, and benefits. Work may involve directing social workers, counselors, or probation officers.
119151.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
119151.title_es: Director de Servicios Sociales y Comunitarios
119151.title_ja: 社会・コミュニティ・サービスマネージャー

119161.title: Emergency Management Director
119161.description: Plan and direct disaster response or crisis management activities, provide disaster preparedness training, and prepare emergency plans and procedures for natural (e.g., hurricanes, floods, earthquakes), wartime, or technological (e.g., nuclear power plant emergencies or hazardous materials spills) disasters or hostage situations.
119161.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training

119171.title: Funeral Home Manager
119171.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate the services or resources of funeral homes. Includes activities such as determining prices for services or merchandise and managing the facilities of funeral homes.
119171.typical_training: Associate's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

119179.title: Personal Service Manager
119179.description: All personal service managers not listed separately.
119179.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
119179.title_ja: パーソナルサービスマネージャー

119199.title: Manager
119199.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

131011.title: Agent or Business Manager
131011.official_title: Agents and Business Managers of Artists, Performers, and Athletes
131011.description: Represent and promote artists, performers, and athletes in dealings with current or prospective employers. May handle contract negotiation and other business matters for clients.
131011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
131011.title_ja: エージェントまたはビジネスマネージャー

131021.title: Farm Products Buyer or Purchasing Agent
131021.official_title: Buyers and Purchasing Agents, Farm Products
131021.description: Purchase farm products either for further processing or resale. Includes tree farm contractors, grain brokers and market operators, grain buyers, and tobacco buyers. May negotiate contracts.
131021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
131021.title_es: Comprador/Agente de Compras de Productos Agrícolas
131021.title_en: Farm Products Buyer or Purchasing Agent
131021.title_zh: 农产品买家或采购代理
131021.title_ja: 農産物バイヤーまたは購買エージェント
131021.title_tl: Mamimili ng mga Produkto ng Farm o Pagbili ng

131022.title: Wholesale and Retail Buyer
131022.official_title: Wholesale and Retail Buyers, Except Farm Products
131022.description: Buy merchandise or commodities, other than farm products, for resale to consumers at the wholesale or retail level, including both durable and nondurable goods. Analyze past buying trends, sales records, price, and quality of merchandise to determine value and yield. Select, order, and authorize payment for merchandise according to contractual agreements. May conduct meetings with sales personnel and introduce new products. May negotiate contracts. Includes assistant wholesale and retail buyers of nonfarm products.
131022.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

131023.title: Purchasing Agent
131023.official_title: Purchasing Agents, Except Wholesale, Retail, and Farm Products
131023.description: Purchase machinery, equipment, tools, parts, supplies, or services necessary for the operation of an establishment. Purchase raw or semifinished materials for manufacturing. May negotiate contracts.
131023.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

131031.title: Claims Adjuster, Examiner, or Investigator
131031.description: Review settled claims to determine that payments and settlements are made in accordance with company practices and procedures. Confer with legal counsel on claims requiring litigation. May also settle insurance claims.
131031.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
131031.title_es: Ajustador, Examinador, o Investigador de Reclamaciones
131031.title_zh: 理赔理算师、审查员或调查员
131031.title_ja: クレームアジャスター、審査官、または調査員

131032.title: Auto Damage Insurance Appraiser
131032.description: Appraise automobile or other vehicle damage to determine repair costs for insurance claim settlement. Prepare insurance forms to indicate repair cost or cost estimates and recommendations. May seek agreement with automotive repair shop on repair costs.
131032.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
131032.title_ja: 自動車損害保険鑑定士

131041.title: Compliance Officer
131041.description: Examine, evaluate, and investigate eligibility for or conformity with laws and regulations governing contract compliance of licenses and permits, and perform other compliance and enforcement inspection and analysis activities not classified elsewhere.
131041.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
131041.title_ja: コンプライアンス・オフィサー

131051.title: Cost Estimator
131051.description: Prepare cost estimates for product manufacturing, construction projects, or services to aid management in bidding on or determining price of product or service. May specialize according to particular service performed or type of product manufactured.
131051.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

131071.title: Human Resources Specialist
131071.description: Recruit, screen, interview, or place individuals within an organization. May perform other activities in multiple human resources areas.
131071.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

131074.title: Farm Labor Contractor
131074.description: Recruit and hire seasonal or temporary agricultural laborers. May transport, house, and provide meals for workers.
131074.typical_training: No formal educational credential, Less than 5 years work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
131074.title_es: Contratista de Mano de Obra Agrícola

131075.title: Labor Relations Specialist
131075.description: Resolve disputes between workers and managers, negotiate collective bargaining agreements, or coordinate grievance procedures to handle employee complaints.
131075.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
131075.title_ja: 労使関係スペシャリスト

131081.title: Logistician
131081.description: Analyze and coordinate the ongoing logistical functions of a firm or organization. Responsible for the entire life cycle of a product, including acquisition, distribution, internal allocation, delivery, and final disposal of resources.
131081.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

131082.title: Project Management Specialist
131082.description: Analyze and coordinate the schedule, timeline, procurement, staffing, and budget of a product or service on a per project basis. Lead and guide the work of technical staff. May serve as a point of contact for the client or customer.
131082.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
131082.title_ja: プロジェクトマネジメントスペシャリスト

131111.title: Management Analyst
131111.description: Conduct organizational studies and evaluations, design systems and procedures, conduct work simplification and measurement studies, and prepare operations and procedures manuals to assist management in operating more efficiently and effectively. Includes program analysts and management consultants.
131111.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

131121.title: Event Planner
131121.description: Coordinate activities of staff, convention personnel, or clients to make arrangements for group meetings, events, or conventions.
131121.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

131131.title: Fundraiser
131131.description: Organize activities to raise funds or otherwise solicit and gather monetary donations or other gifts for an organization. May design and produce promotional materials. May also raise awareness of the organization’s work, goals, and financial needs.
131131.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

131141.title: Compensation, Benefits, and Job Analysis Specialist
131141.official_title: Compensation, Benefits, and Job Analysis Specialists
131141.description: Conduct programs of compensation and benefits and job analysis for employer. May specialize in specific areas, such as position classification and pension programs.
131141.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
131141.title_es: Especialista en Compensaciones, Beneficios, y Análisis Ocupacional
131141.title_en: Compensation, Benefits, and Job Analysis Specialist
131141.title_zh: 薪酬、福利和工作分析专家
131141.title_ja: 報酬、福利厚生、ジョブ分析スペシャリスト
131141.title_tl: Compensation, Mga Benepisyo, at Dalubhasa sa Pagsusuri

131151.title: Training and Development Specialist
131151.description: Design or conduct work-related training and development programs to improve individual skills or organizational performance. May analyze organizational training needs or evaluate training effectiveness.
131151.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
131151.title_ja: トレーニングと開発スペシャリスト

131161.title: Market Research Analyst or Marketing Specialist
131161.official_title: Market Research Analysts and Marketing Specialists
131161.description: Research conditions in local, regional, national, or online markets. Gather information to determine potential sales of a product or service, or plan a marketing or advertising campaign. May gather information on competitors, prices, sales, and methods of marketing and distribution. May employ search marketing tactics, analyze web metrics, and develop recommendations to increase search engine ranking and visibility to target markets.
131161.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
131161.title_es: Analista de Investigación de Mercado y Especialista en Mercadeo
131161.title_en: Market Research Analyst or Marketing Specialist
131161.title_zh: 市场研究分析师或营销专员
131161.title_ja: 市場調査アナリストまたはマーケティングスペシャリスト
131161.title_tl: Market Research Analyst o Espesyalista sa Marketing

131199.title: Business Operations Specialist
131199.description: All business operations specialists not listed separately.
131199.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
131199.title_ja: ビジネスオペレーションスペシャリスト

132011.title: Accountants Auditor
132011.description: Examine, analyze, and interpret accounting records to prepare financial statements, give advice, or audit and evaluate statements prepared by others. Install or advise on systems of recording costs or other financial and budgetary data.
132011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

132022.title: Property Appraiser
132022.official_title: Appraisers of Personal and Business Property
132022.description: Appraise and estimate the fair value of tangible personal or business property, such as jewelry, art, antiques, collectibles, and equipment. Includes workers who appraise both personal and business property as well as real estate. May also appraise land.
132022.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

132023.title: Real Estate Appraiser or Assessor
132023.official_title: Appraisers and Assessors of Real Estate
132023.description: Appraise real estate, exclusively, and estimate its fair value. May assess taxes in accordance with prescribed schedules.
132023.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
132023.title_es: Tasador/Especialista en Valoración de Bienes Raíces
132023.title_ja: 不動産鑑定士・査定人

132031.title: Budget Analyst
132031.description: Examine budget estimates for completeness, accuracy, and conformance with procedures and regulations. Analyze budgeting and accounting reports.
132031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

132041.title: Credit Analyst
132041.description: Analyze credit data and financial statements of individuals or firms to determine the degree of risk involved in extending credit or lending money. Prepare reports with credit information for use in decisionmaking.
132041.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
132041.title_ja: クレジット・アナリスト

132051.title: Financial Analyst
132051.description: Conduct quantitative analyses of information involving investment programs or financial data of public or private institutions, including valuation of businesses.
132051.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

132052.title: Personal Advisor
132052.description: Advise clients on financial plans using knowledge of tax and investment strategies, securities, insurance, pension plans, and real estate. Duties include assessing clients' assets, liabilities, cash flow, insurance coverage, tax status, and financial objectives. May also buy and sell financial assets for clients.
132052.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
132052.title_ja: パーソナルアドバイザー

132053.title: Insurance Underwriter
132053.description: Review individual applications for insurance to evaluate degree of risk involved and determine acceptance of applications.
132053.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

132054.title: Financial Risk Specialist
132054.description: Analyze and measure exposure to credit and market risk threatening the assets, earning capacity, or economic state of an organization. May make recommendations to limit risk.
132054.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
132054.title_ja: 金融リスクスペシャリスト

132061.title: Financial Examiner
132061.description: Enforce or ensure compliance with laws and regulations governing financial and securities institutions and financial and real estate transactions. May examine, verify, or authenticate records.
132061.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

132071.title: Credit Counselor
132071.description: Advise and educate individuals or organizations on acquiring and managing debt. May provide guidance in determining the best type of loan and explain loan requirements or restrictions. May help develop debt management plans or student financial aid packages. May advise on credit issues, or provide budget, mortgage, bankruptcy, or student financial aid counseling.
132071.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
132071.title_ja: クレジット・カウンセラー

132072.title: Loan Officer
132072.description: Evaluate, authorize, or recommend approval of commercial, real estate, or credit loans. Advise borrowers on financial status and payment methods. Includes mortgage loan officers and agents, collection analysts, loan servicing officers, loan underwriters, and payday loan officers.
132072.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

132081.title: Tax Examiner, Collector, or Revenue Agent
132081.official_title: Tax Examiners and Collectors, and Revenue Agents
132081.description: Determine tax liability or collect taxes from individuals or business firms according to prescribed laws and regulations.
132081.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
132081.title_es: Examinador/Cobrador de Impuestos o Agente de Rentas Públicas
132081.title_zh: 税务审查员/收税员或税务代理人
132081.title_ja: 税務調査官/徴収人、または歳入エージェント

132082.title: Tax Preparer
132082.description: Prepare tax returns for individuals or small businesses.
132082.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

132099.title: Financial Specialist
132099.description: All financial specialists not listed separately.
132099.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

151211.title: Computer Analyst
151211.description: Analyze science, engineering, business, and other data processing problems to develop and implement solutions to complex applications problems, system administration issues, or network concerns. Perform systems management and integration functions, improve existing computer systems, and review computer system capabilities, workflow, and schedule limitations. May analyze or recommend commercially available software.
151211.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
151211.title_ja: コンピューターアナリスト

151212.title: Information Analyst
151212.description: Plan, implement, upgrade, or monitor security measures for the protection of computer networks and information. Assess system vulnerabilities for security risks and propose and implement risk mitigation strategies. May ensure appropriate security controls are in place that will safeguard digital files and vital electronic infrastructure. May respond to computer security breaches and viruses.
151212.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
151212.title_es: Analista de Seguridad de la Información

151221.title: Computer and Information Research Scientist
151221.description: Conduct research into fundamental computer and information science as theorists, designers, or inventors. Develop solutions to problems in the field of computer hardware and software.
151221.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
151221.title_es: Investigador de Ciencias de la Computación e Información
151221.title_zh: 计算机与信息研究科学家
151221.title_ja: コンピュータ情報研究員

151231.title: Computer Network Support Specialist
151231.description: Analyze, test, troubleshoot, and evaluate existing network systems, such as local area networks (LAN), wide area networks (WAN), cloud networks, servers, and other data communications networks. Perform network maintenance to ensure networks operate correctly with minimal interruption.
151231.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
151231.title_es: Especialista en Apoyo Técnico de Computadoras y Redes Informáticas
151231.title_ja: コンピュータネットワークサポートスペシャリスト
151231.title_tl: Specialist sa Suporta sa Network ng Computer

151232.title: Computer User Support Specialist
151232.description: Provide technical assistance to computer users. Answer questions or resolve computer problems for clients in person, via telephone, or electronically. May provide assistance concerning the use of computer hardware and software, including printing, installation, word processing, electronic mail, and operating systems.
151232.typical_training: Some college, no degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
151232.title_es: Especialista en Apoyo Técnico para Usuarios de Computadoras
151232.title_ja: コンピュータユーザーサポートスペシャリスト
151232.title_tl: Espesyalista sa Suporta sa User ng

151241.title: Computer Network Architect
151241.description: Design and implement computer and information networks, such as local area networks (LAN), wide area networks (WAN), intranets, extranets, and other data communications networks. Perform network modeling, analysis, and planning, including analysis of capacity needs for network infrastructures. May also design network and computer security measures. May research and recommend network and data communications hardware and software.
151241.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
151241.title_ja: コンピュータネットワークアーキテクト

151242.title: Database Administrator
151242.description: Administer, test, and implement computer databases, applying knowledge of database management systems. Coordinate changes to computer databases. Identify, investigate, and resolve database performance issues, database capacity, and database scalability. May plan, coordinate, and implement security measures to safeguard computer databases.
151242.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

151243.title: Database Architect
151243.description: Design strategies for enterprise databases, data warehouse systems, and multidimensional networks. Set standards for database operations, programming, query processes, and security. Model, design, and construct large relational databases or data warehouses. Create and optimize data models for warehouse infrastructure and workflow. Integrate new systems with existing warehouse structure and refine system performance and functionality.
151243.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
151243.title_ja: データベースアーキテクト

151244.title: Network and Computer Systems Administrator
151244.description: Install, configure, and maintain an organization’s local area network (LAN), wide area network (WAN), data communications network, operating systems, and physical and virtual servers. Perform system monitoring and verify the integrity and availability of hardware, network, and server resources and systems. Review system and application logs and verify completion of scheduled jobs, including system backups. Analyze network and server resource consumption and control user access. Install and upgrade software and maintain software licenses. May assist in network modeling, analysis, planning, and coordination between network and data communications hardware and software.
151244.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
151244.title_es: Administradora/Administrador de Redes Informáticas y Sistemas de Computación
151244.title_zh: 网络和计算机系统管理员
151244.title_ja: ネットワークおよびコンピュータシステム管理者
151244.title_tl: Administrator ng Network at Computer System

151251.title: Computer Programmer
151251.description: Create, modify, and test the code and scripts that allow computer applications to run. Work from specifications drawn up by software and web developers or other individuals. May develop and write computer programs to store, locate, and retrieve specific documents, data, and information.
151251.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
151251.title_ja: コンピュータープログラマー

151252.title: Software Developer
151252.description: Research, design, and develop computer and network software or specialized utility programs. Analyze user needs and develop software solutions, applying principles and techniques of computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis. Update software or enhance existing software capabilities. May work with computer hardware engineers to integrate hardware and software systems, and develop specifications and performance requirements. May maintain databases within an application area, working individually or coordinating database development as part of a team.
151252.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

151253.title: Software Quality Assurance Analyst
151253.official_title: Software Quality Assurance Analysts and Testers
151253.description: Develop and execute software tests to identify software problems and their causes. Test system modifications to prepare for implementation. Document software and application defects using a bug tracking system and report defects to software or web developers. Create and maintain databases of known defects. May participate in software design reviews to provide input on functional requirements, operational characteristics, product designs, and schedules.
151253.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
151253.title_es: Analista de Control de Calidad de Software
151253.title_ja: ソフトウェア品質保証アナリスト
151253.title_tl: Analyst ng Kalidad ng Kalidad ng Software

151254.title: Web Developer
151254.description: Develop and implement websites, web applications, application databases, and interactive web interfaces. Evaluate code to ensure that it is properly structured, meets industry standards, and is compatible with browsers and devices. Optimize website performance, scalability, and server-side code and processes. May develop website infrastructure and integrate websites with other computer applications.
151254.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

151255.title: Web and Digital Interface Designer
151255.description: Design digital user interfaces or websites. Develop and test layouts, interfaces, functionality, and navigation menus to ensure compatibility and usability across browsers or devices. May use web framework applications as well as client-side code and processes. May evaluate web design following web and accessibility standards, and may analyze web use metrics and optimize websites for marketability and search engine ranking. May design and test interfaces that facilitate the human-computer interaction and maximize the usability of digital devices, websites, and software with a focus on aesthetics and design. May create graphics used in websites and manage website content and links.
151255.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
151255.title_es: Diseñadora/Diseñador de Página Web y de Interfaz Digital
151255.title_zh: Web 和数字界面设计师
151255.title_ja: Web およびデジタルインターフェイスデザイナー
151255.title_tl: Designer ng Web at Digital Interface

151299.title: Computer Occupation
151299.description: All computer occupations not listed separately.
151299.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

152011.title: Actuary
152011.description: Analyze statistical data, such as mortality, accident, sickness, disability, and retirement rates and construct probability tables to forecast risk and liability for payment of future benefits. May ascertain insurance rates required and cash reserves necessary to ensure payment of future benefits.
152011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

152021.title: Mathematician
152021.description: Conduct research in fundamental mathematics or in application of mathematical techniques to science, management, and other fields. Solve problems in various fields using mathematical methods.
152021.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

152031.title: Operations Research Analyst
152031.description: Formulate and apply mathematical modeling and other optimizing methods to develop and interpret information that assists management with decisionmaking, policy formulation, or other managerial functions. May collect and analyze data and develop decision support software, services, or products. May develop and supply optimal time, cost, or logistics networks for program evaluation, review, or implementation.
152031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
152031.title_ja: オペレーションズ・リサーチ・アナリスト

152041.title: Statistician
152041.description: Develop or apply mathematical or statistical theory and methods to collect, organize, interpret, and summarize numerical data to provide usable information. May specialize in fields such as biostatistics, agricultural statistics, business statistics, or economic statistics. Includes mathematical and survey statisticians.
152041.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

152051.title: Data Scientist
152051.description: Develop and implement a set of techniques or analytics applications to transform raw data into meaningful information using data-oriented programming languages and visualization software. Apply data mining, data modeling, natural language processing, and machine learning to extract and analyze information from large structured and unstructured datasets. Visualize, interpret, and report data findings. May create dynamic data reports.
152051.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
152051.title_ja: データサイエンティスト

152099.title: Mathematical Science Occupation
152099.description: All mathematical scientists not listed separately.
152099.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
152099.title_es: Ocupación Relacionada con las Ciencias Matemáticas

171011.title: Architect
171011.description: Plan and design structures, such as private residences, office buildings, theaters, factories, and other structural property.
171011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

171012.title: Landscape Architect
171012.description: Plan and design land areas for projects such as parks and other recreational facilities, airports, highways, hospitals, schools, land subdivisions, and commercial, industrial, and residential sites.
171012.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, Internship/residency
171012.title_ja: ランドスケープ・アーキテクト

171021.title: Cartographer/Photogrammetrist
171021.description: Research, study, and prepare maps and other spatial data in digital or graphic form for one or more purposes, such as legal, social, political, educational, and design purposes. May work with Geographic Information Systems (GIS). May design and evaluate algorithms, data structures, and user interfaces for GIS and mapping systems. May collect, analyze, and interpret geographic information provided by geodetic surveys, aerial photographs, and satellite data.
171021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
171021.title_ja: 地図製作者／写真測量家

171022.title: Surveyor
171022.description: Make exact measurements and determine property boundaries. Provide data relevant to the shape, contour, gravitation, location, elevation, or dimension of land or land features on or near the earth’s surface for engineering, mapmaking, mining, land evaluation, construction, and other purposes.
171022.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

172011.title: Aerospace Engineer
172011.description: Perform engineering duties in designing, constructing, and testing aircraft, missiles, and spacecraft. May conduct basic and applied research to evaluate adaptability of materials and equipment to aircraft design and manufacture. May recommend improvements in testing equipment and techniques.
172011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

172021.title: Agricultural Engineer
172021.description: Apply knowledge of engineering technology and biological science to agricultural problems concerned with power and machinery, electrification, structures, soil and water conservation, and processing of agricultural products.
172021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

172031.title: Bioengineer or Biomedical Engineer
172031.description: Apply knowledge of engineering, biology, chemistry, computer science, and biomechanical principles to the design, development, and evaluation of biological, agricultural, and health systems and products, such as artificial organs, prostheses, instrumentation, medical information systems, and health management and care delivery systems.
172031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
172031.title_zh: 生物工程师或生物医学工程师
172031.title_ja: バイオエンジニアまたはバイオメディカルエンジニア

172041.title: Chemical Engineer
172041.description: Design chemical plant equipment and devise processes for manufacturing chemicals and products, such as gasoline, synthetic rubber, plastics, detergents, cement, paper, and pulp, by applying principles and technology of chemistry, physics, and engineering.
172041.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

172051.title: Civil Engineer
172051.description: Perform engineering duties in planning, designing, and overseeing construction and maintenance of building structures and facilities, such as roads, railroads, airports, bridges, harbors, channels, dams, irrigation projects, pipelines, power plants, and water and sewage systems. Includes architectural, structural, traffic, and geotechnical engineers.
172051.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

172061.title: Computer Hardware Engineer
172061.description: Research, design, develop, or test computer or computer-related equipment for commercial, industrial, military, or scientific use. May supervise the manufacturing and installation of computer or computer-related equipment and components.
172061.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
172061.title_ja: コンピューターハードウェアエンジニア

172071.title: Electrical Engineer
172071.description: Research, design, develop, test, or supervise the manufacturing and installation of electrical equipment, components, or systems for commercial, industrial, military, or scientific use.
172071.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

172072.title: Electronics Engineer
172072.description: Research, design, develop, or test electronic components and systems for commercial, industrial, military, or scientific use employing knowledge of electronic theory and materials properties. Design electronic circuits and components for use in fields such as telecommunications, aerospace guidance and propulsion control, acoustics, or instruments and controls.
172072.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
172072.title_ja: エレクトロニクスエンジニア

172081.title: Environmental Engineer
172081.description: Research, design, plan, or perform engineering duties in the prevention, control, and remediation of environmental hazards using various engineering disciplines. Work may include waste treatment, site remediation, or pollution control technology.
172081.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

172111.title: Health and Safety Engineer
172111.official_title: Health and Safety Engineers, Except Mining Safety Engineers and Inspectors
172111.description: Promote worksite or product safety by applying knowledge of industrial processes, mechanics, chemistry, psychology, and industrial health and safety laws. Includes industrial product safety engineers.
172111.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

172112.title: Industrial Engineer
172112.description: Design, develop, test, and evaluate integrated systems for managing industrial production processes, including human work factors, quality control, inventory control, logistics and material flow, cost analysis, and production coordination.
172112.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

172121.title: Marine Engineer
172121.description: Design, develop, and evaluate the operation of marine vessels, ship machinery, and related equipment, such as power supply and propulsion systems.
172121.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

172131.title: Materials Engineer
172131.description: Evaluate materials and develop machinery and processes to manufacture materials for use in products that must meet specialized design and performance specifications. Develop new uses for known materials. Includes those engineers working with composite materials or specializing in one type of material, such as graphite, metal and metal alloys, ceramics and glass, plastics and polymers, and naturally occurring materials. Includes metallurgists and metallurgical engineers, ceramic engineers, and welding engineers.
172131.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
172131.title_ja: マテリアルエンジニア

172141.title: Mechanical Engineer
172141.description: Perform engineering duties in planning and designing tools, engines, machines, and other mechanically functioning equipment. Oversee installation, operation, maintenance, and repair of equipment such as centralized heat, gas, water, and steam systems.
172141.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
172141.title_ja: メカニカルエンジニア

172151.title: Mining or Geological Engineer
172151.official_title: Mining and Geological Engineers, Including Mining Safety Engineers
172151.description: Conduct subsurface surveys to identify the characteristics of potential land or mining development sites. May specify the ground support systems, processes, and equipment for safe, economical, and environmentally sound extraction or underground construction activities. May inspect areas for unsafe geological conditions, equipment, and working conditions. May design, implement, and coordinate mine safety programs.
172151.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
172151.title_ja: 鉱業または地質エンジニア

172161.title: Nuclear Engineer
172161.description: Conduct research on nuclear engineering projects or apply principles and theory of nuclear science to problems concerned with release, control, and use of nuclear energy and nuclear waste disposal.
172161.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

172171.title: Petroleum Engineer
172171.description: Devise methods to improve oil and gas extraction and production and determine the need for new or modified tool designs. Oversee drilling and offer technical advice.
172171.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

172199.title: Engineer
172199.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

173011.title: Architectural or Civil Drafter
173011.description: Prepare detailed drawings of architectural and structural features of buildings or drawings and topographical relief maps used in civil engineering projects, such as highways, bridges, and public works. Use knowledge of building materials, engineering practices, and mathematics to complete drawings.
173011.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
173011.title_es: Delineante de Planos Arquitectónicos o Civil
173011.title_ja: 建築製または民事製図家

173012.title: Electrical or Electronic Drafter
173012.description: Prepare wiring diagrams, circuit board assembly diagrams, and layout drawings used for the manufacture, installation, or repair of electrical equipment.
173012.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
173012.title_es: Delineante de Sistemas Eléctricos y Electrónicos
173012.title_ja: 電気または電子ドラフター

173013.title: Mechanical Drafter
173013.description: Prepare detailed working diagrams of machinery and mechanical devices, including dimensions, fastening methods, and other engineering information.
173013.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
173013.title_ja: メカニカルドラフター

173019.title: Drafter
173019.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

173021.title: Aerospace Engineering Technologist/Technician
173021.official_title: Aerospace Engineering and Operations Technologists and Technicians
173021.description: Operate, install, adjust, and maintain integrated computer/communications systems, consoles, simulators, and other data acquisition, test, and measurement instruments and equipment, which are used to launch, track, position, and evaluate air and space vehicles. May record and interpret test data.
173021.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
173021.title_es: Tecnólogo/Técnico en Ingeniería y Operaciones Aeroespaciales
173021.title_zh: 航空航天工程技术员/技术员
173021.title_ja: 航空宇宙工学技術者/技術者

173022.title: Civil Engineering Technologist/Technician
173022.description: Apply theory and principles of civil engineering in planning, designing, and overseeing construction and maintenance of structures and facilities under the direction of engineering staff or physical scientists.
173022.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
173022.title_zh: 土木工程技术员/技术员

173023.title: Electrical/Electronic Engineering Technologist/Technician
173023.official_title: Electrical and Electronic Engineering Technologists and Technicians
173023.description: Apply electrical and electronic theory and related knowledge, usually under the direction of engineering staff, to design, build, repair, adjust, and modify electrical components, circuitry, controls, and machinery for subsequent evaluation and use by engineering staff in making engineering design decisions.
173023.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
173023.title_zh: 电气/电子工程技术员/技术员
173023.title_ja: 電気電子工学技術者/技術者

173024.title: Electro-Mechanical/Mechatronic Technologist/Technician
173024.official_title: Electro-Mechanical and Mechatronics Technologists and Technicians
173024.description: Operate, test, maintain, or adjust unmanned, automated, servomechanical, or electromechanical equipment. May operate unmanned submarines, aircraft, or other equipment to observe or record visual information at sites such as oil rigs, crop fields, buildings, or for similar infrastructure, deep ocean exploration, or hazardous waste removal. May assist engineers in testing and designing robotics equipment.
173024.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
173024.title_zh: 机电/机电一体化技术员/技术员
173024.title_ja: 電気機械/メカトロニクス技術者/技術者

173025.title: Environmental Engineering Technologist/Technician
173025.description: Apply theory and principles of environmental engineering to modify, test, and operate equipment and devices used in the prevention, control, and remediation of environmental problems, including waste treatment and site remediation, under the direction of engineering staff or scientists. May assist in the development of environmental remediation devices.
173025.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
173025.title_zh: 环境工程技术员/技术员
173025.title_ja: 環境工学技術者/技術者

173026.title: Industrial Engineering Technologist/Technician
173026.description: Apply engineering theory and principles to problems of industrial layout or manufacturing production, usually under the direction of engineering staff. May perform time and motion studies on worker operations in a variety of industries for purposes such as establishing standard production rates or improving efficiency.
173026.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
173026.title_zh: 工业工程技术员/技术员
173026.title_ja: インダストリアル・エンジニアリング・テクノロジスト/技術者

173027.title: Mechanical Engineering Technologist/Technician
173027.description: Apply theory and principles of mechanical engineering to modify, develop, test, or adjust machinery and equipment under direction of engineering staff or physical scientists.
173027.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
173027.title_zh: 机械工程技术员/技术员
173027.title_ja: 機械工学技術者/技術者

173028.title: Calibration Technologists/Technician
173028.description: Execute or adapt procedures and techniques for calibrating measurement devices, by applying knowledge of measurement science, mathematics, physics, chemistry, and electronics, sometimes under the direction of engineering staff. Determine measurement standard suitability for calibrating measurement devices. May perform preventive maintenance on equipment. May perform corrective actions to address identified calibration problems.
173028.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

173029.title: Engineering Technologists/Technician
173029.official_title: Engineering Technologists and Technicians, Except Drafters, All Other
173029.description: All engineering technologists and technicians, except drafters, not listed separately.
173029.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
173029.title_ja: エンジニアリング技術者/技術者

173031.title: Surveying and Mapping Technician
173031.description: Perform surveying and mapping duties, usually under the direction of an engineer, surveyor, cartographer, or photogrammetrist, to obtain data used for construction, mapmaking, boundary location, mining, or other purposes. May calculate mapmaking information and create maps from source data, such as surveying notes, aerial photography, satellite data, or other maps to show topographical features, political boundaries, and other features. May verify accuracy and completeness of maps.
173031.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
173031.title_ja: 測量およびマッピング技術者

191011.title: Animal Scientist
191011.description: Conduct research in the genetics, nutrition, reproduction, growth, and development of domestic farm animals.
191011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

191012.title: Food Scientist/Technologist
191012.description: Use chemistry, microbiology, engineering, and other sciences to study the principles underlying the processing and deterioration of foods; analyze food content to determine levels of vitamins, fat, sugar, and protein; discover new food sources; research ways to make processed foods safe, palatable, and healthful; and apply food science knowledge to determine best ways to process, package, preserve, store, and distribute food.
191012.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

191013.title: Soil and Plant Scientist
191013.description: Conduct research in breeding, physiology, production, yield, and management of crops and agricultural plants or trees, shrubs, and nursery stock, their growth in soils, and control of pests; or study the chemical, physical, biological, and mineralogical composition of soils as they relate to plant or crop growth. May classify and map soils and investigate effects of alternative practices on soil and crop productivity.
191013.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
191013.title_es: Científico Especializado en Suelos y Botánica

191021.title: Biochemist/Biophysicist
191021.description: Study the chemical composition or physical principles of living cells and organisms, their electrical and mechanical energy, and related phenomena. May conduct research to further understanding of the complex chemical combinations and reactions involved in metabolism, reproduction, growth, and heredity. May determine the effects of foods, drugs, serums, hormones, and other substances on tissues and vital processes of living organisms.
191021.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
191021.title_zh: 生物化学家/生物物理学家
191021.title_ja: 生化学者/生物物理学者

191022.title: Microbiologist
191022.description: Investigate the growth, structure, development, and other characteristics of microscopic organisms, such as bacteria, algae, or fungi. Includes medical microbiologists who study the relationship between organisms and disease or the effects of antibiotics on microorganisms.
191022.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

191023.title: Zoologist/Wildlife Biologist
191023.description: Study the origins, behavior, diseases, genetics, and life processes of animals and wildlife. May specialize in wildlife research and management. May collect and analyze biological data to determine the environmental effects of present and potential use of land and water habitats.
191023.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
191023.title_zh: 动物学家/野生生物学家
191023.title_ja: 動物学者/野生生物生物学者

191029.title: Biological Scientist
191029.description: All biological scientists not listed separately.
191029.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

191031.title: Conservation Scientist
191031.description: Manage, improve, and protect natural resources to maximize their use without damaging the environment. May conduct soil surveys and develop plans to eliminate soil erosion or to protect rangelands. May instruct farmers, agricultural production managers, or ranchers in best ways to use crop rotation, contour plowing, or terracing to conserve soil and water; in the number and kind of livestock and forage plants best suited to particular ranges; and in range and farm improvements, such as fencing and reservoirs for stock watering.
191031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

191032.title: Forester
191032.description: Manage public and private forested lands for economic, recreational, and conservation purposes. May inventory the type, amount, and location of standing timber, appraise the timber’s worth, negotiate the purchase, and draw up contracts for procurement. May determine how to conserve wildlife habitats, creek beds, water quality, and soil stability, and how best to comply with environmental regulations. May devise plans for planting and growing new trees, monitor trees for healthy growth, and determine optimal harvesting schedules.
191032.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

191041.title: Epidemiologist
191041.description: Investigate and describe the determinants and distribution of disease, disability, or health outcomes. May develop the means for prevention and control.
191041.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

191042.title: Medical Scientist
191042.description: Conduct research dealing with the understanding of human diseases and the improvement of human health. Engage in clinical investigation, research and development, or other related activities. Includes physicians, dentists, pharmacologists, and medical pathologists who primarily conduct research. Practitioners who primarily provide medical or dental care or dispense drugs are included in “Healthcare Diagnosing or Treating Practitioners”.
191042.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
191042.title_ja: メディカルサイエンティスト

191099.title: Life Scientist
191099.description: All life scientists not listed separately.
191099.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
191099.title_ja: ライフサイエンティスト

192011.title: Astronomer
192011.description: Observe, research, and interpret astronomical phenomena to increase basic knowledge or apply such information to practical problems.
192011.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

192012.title: Physicist
192012.description: Conduct research into physical phenomena, develop theories on the basis of observation and experiments, and devise methods to apply physical laws and theories.
192012.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

192021.title: Atmospheric and Space Scientist
192021.description: Investigate atmospheric phenomena and interpret meteorological data, gathered by surface and air stations, satellites, and radar to prepare reports and forecasts for public and other uses. Includes weather analysts and forecasters whose functions require the detailed knowledge of meteorology.
192021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

192031.title: Chemist
192031.description: Conduct qualitative and quantitative chemical analyses or experiments in laboratories for quality or process control or to develop new products or knowledge.
192031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

192032.title: Materials Scientist
192032.description: Research and study the structures and chemical properties of various natural and synthetic or composite materials, including metals, alloys, rubber, ceramics, semiconductors, polymers, and glass. Determine ways to strengthen or combine materials or develop new materials with new or specific properties for use in a variety of products and applications. Includes glass scientists, ceramic scientists, metallurgical scientists, and polymer scientists.
192032.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
192032.title_ja: マテリアルサイエンティスト

192041.title: Environmental Scientist/Specialist
192041.official_title: Environmental Scientists and Specialists, Including Health
192041.description: Conduct research or perform investigation for the purpose of identifying, abating, or eliminating sources of pollutants or hazards that affect either the environment or public health. Using knowledge of various scientific disciplines, may collect, synthesize, study, report, and recommend action based on data derived from measurements or observations of air, food, soil, water, and other sources.
192041.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
192041.title_ja: 環境科学者/スペシャリスト

192042.title: Geoscientist
192042.description: Study the composition, structure, and other physical aspects of the Earth. May use geological, physics, and mathematics knowledge in exploration for oil, gas, minerals, or underground water; or in waste disposal, land reclamation, or other environmental problems. May study the Earth’s internal composition, atmospheres, and oceans, and its magnetic, electrical, and gravitational forces. Includes mineralogists, paleontologists, stratigraphers, geodesists, and seismologists.
192042.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

192043.title: Hydrologist
192043.description: Research the distribution, circulation, and physical properties of underground and surface waters; and study the form and intensity of precipitation and its rate of infiltration into the soil, movement through the earth, and return to the ocean and atmosphere.
192043.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

192099.title: Physical Scientist
192099.description: All physical scientists not listed separately.
192099.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

193011.title: Economist
193011.description: Conduct research, prepare reports, or formulate plans to address economic problems related to the production and distribution of goods and services or monetary and fiscal policy. May collect and process economic and statistical data using sampling techniques and econometric methods.
193011.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

193022.title: Survey Researcher
193022.description: Plan, develop, or conduct surveys. May analyze and interpret the meaning of survey data, determine survey objectives, or suggest or test question wording. Includes social scientists who primarily design questionnaires or supervise survey teams.
193022.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

193032.title: Industrial-Organizational Psychologist
193032.description: Apply principles of psychology to human resources, administration, management, sales, and marketing problems. Activities may include policy planning; employee testing and selection, training, and development; and organizational development and analysis. May work with management to organize the work setting to improve worker productivity.
193032.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

193033.title: Clinical and Counseling Psychologist
193033.description: Assess, diagnose, and treat mental and emotional disorders of individuals through observation, interview, and psychological tests. Help individuals with distress or maladjustment understand their problems through their knowledge of case history, interviews with patients, and theory. Provide individual or group counseling services to assist individuals in achieving more effective personal, social, educational, and vocational development and adjustment. May design behavior modification programs and consult with medical personnel regarding the best treatment for patients.
193033.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency
193033.title_ja: 臨床・カウンセリング心理士

193034.title: School Psychologist
193034.description: Diagnose and implement individual or schoolwide interventions or strategies to address educational, behavioral, or developmental issues that adversely impact educational functioning in a school. May address student learning and behavioral problems and counsel students or families. May design and implement performance plans, and evaluate performance. May consult with other school-based personnel.
193034.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

193039.title: Psychologist
193039.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

193041.title: Sociologist
193041.description: Study human society and social behavior by examining the groups and social institutions that people form, as well as various social, religious, political, and business organizations. May study the behavior and interaction of groups, trace their origin and growth, and analyze the influence of group activities on individual members.
193041.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

193051.title: Urban and Regional Planner
193051.description: Develop comprehensive plans and programs for use of land and physical facilities of jurisdictions, such as towns, cities, counties, and metropolitan areas.
193051.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
193051.title_ja: 都市・地域プランナー

193091.title: Anthropologists/Archeologist
193091.description: Study the origin, development, and behavior of human beings. May study the way of life, language, or physical characteristics of people in various parts of the world. May engage in systematic recovery and examination of material evidence, such as tools or pottery remaining from past human cultures, in order to determine the history, customs, and living habits of earlier civilizations.
193091.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

193092.title: Geographer
193092.description: Study the nature and use of areas of the Earth’s surface, relating and interpreting interactions of physical and cultural phenomena. Conduct research on physical aspects of a region, including land forms, climates, soils, plants, and animals, and conduct research on the spatial implications of human activities within a given area, including social characteristics, economic activities, and political organization, as well as researching interdependence between regions at scales ranging from local to global.
193092.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

193093.title: Historian
193093.description: Research, analyze, record, and interpret the past as recorded in sources, such as government and institutional records, newspapers and other periodicals, photographs, interviews, films, electronic media, and unpublished manuscripts, such as personal diaries and letters.
193093.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

193094.title: Political Scientist
193094.description: Study the origin, development, and operation of political systems. May study topics, such as public opinion, political decisionmaking, and ideology. May analyze the structure and operation of governments, as well as various political entities. May conduct public opinion surveys, analyze election results, or analyze public documents.
193094.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

193099.title: Social Scientist
193099.official_title: Social Scientists and Related Workers, All Other
193099.description: All social scientists and related workers not listed separately.
193099.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

194012.title: Agricultural Technician
194012.description: Work with agricultural scientists in plant, fiber, and animal research, or assist with animal breeding and nutrition. Set up or maintain laboratory equipment and collect samples from crops or animals. Prepare specimens or record data to assist scientists in biology or related life science experiments. Conduct tests and experiments to improve yield and quality of crops or to increase the resistance of plants and animals to disease or insects.
194012.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

194013.title: Food Science Technician
194013.description: Work with food scientists or technologists to perform standardized qualitative and quantitative tests to determine physical or chemical properties of food or beverage products. Includes technicians who assist in research and development of production technology, quality control, packaging, processing, and use of foods.
194013.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
194013.title_es: Técnico de Ciencias de los Alimentos

194021.title: Biological Technician
194021.description: Assist biological and medical scientists. Set up, operate, and maintain laboratory instruments and equipment, monitor experiments, collect data and samples, make observations, and calculate and record results. May analyze organic substances, such as blood, food, and drugs.
194021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

194031.title: Chemical Technician
194031.description: Conduct chemical and physical laboratory tests to assist scientists in making qualitative and quantitative analyses of solids, liquids, and gaseous materials for research and development of new products or processes, quality control, maintenance of environmental standards, and other work involving experimental, theoretical, or practical application of chemistry and related sciences.
194031.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

194042.title: Environmental Science and Protection Technician
194042.official_title: Environmental Science and Protection Technicians, Including Health
194042.description: Perform laboratory and field tests to monitor the environment and investigate sources of pollution, including those that affect health, under the direction of an environmental scientist, engineer, or other specialist. May collect samples of gases, soil, water, and other materials for testing.
194042.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
194042.title_es: Técnico del Medioambiente y de Protección
194042.title_zh: 环境科学与保护技术员
194042.title_ja: 環境科学・保護技術者
194042.title_tl: Tekniko ng Agham at Proteksyon sa Kapaligiran

194043.title: Geological Technician
194043.description: Assist scientists or engineers in the use of electronic, sonic, or nuclear measuring instruments in laboratory, exploration, and production activities to obtain data indicating resources such as metallic ore, minerals, gas, coal, or petroleum. Analyze mud and drill cuttings. Chart pressure, temperature, and other characteristics of wells or bore holes.
194043.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

194044.title: Hydrologic Technician
194044.description: Collect and organize data concerning the distribution and circulation of ground and surface water, and data on its physical, chemical, and biological properties. Measure and report on flow rates and ground water levels, maintain field equipment, collect water samples, install and collect sampling equipment, and process samples for shipment to testing laboratories. May collect data on behalf of hydrologists, engineers, developers, government agencies, or agriculture.
194044.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

194051.title: Nuclear Technician
194051.description: Assist nuclear physicists, nuclear engineers, or other scientists in laboratory, power generation, or electricity production activities. May operate, maintain, or provide quality control for nuclear testing and research equipment. May monitor radiation.
194051.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

194061.title: Social Science Research Assistant
