194061.description: Assist social scientists in laboratory, survey, and other social science research. May help prepare findings for publication and assist in laboratory analysis, quality control, or data management.
194061.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
194061.title_es: Asistente de Investigación en Ciencias Sociales
194061.title_ja: 社会科学リサーチアシスタント

194071.title: Forest and Conservation Technician
194071.description: Provide technical assistance regarding the conservation of soil, water, forests, or related natural resources. May compile data pertaining to size, content, condition, and other characteristics of forest tracts under the direction of foresters, or train and lead forest workers in forest propagation and fire prevention and suppression. May assist conservation scientists in managing, improving, and protecting rangelands and wildlife habitats.
194071.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

194092.title: Forensic Science Technician
194092.description: Collect, identify, classify, and analyze physical evidence related to criminal investigations. Perform tests on weapons or substances, such as fiber, hair, and tissue to determine significance to investigation. May testify as expert witnesses on evidence or crime laboratory techniques. May serve as specialists in area of expertise, such as ballistics, fingerprinting, handwriting, or biochemistry.
194092.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

194099.title: Life, Physical, and Social Science Technician
194099.official_title: Life, Physical, and Social Science Technicians, All Other
194099.description: All life, physical, and social science technicians not listed separately.
194099.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
194099.title_es: Técnico en Ciencias Biológicas, Físicas y Sociales
194099.title_en: Life, Physical, and Social Science Technician
194099.title_zh: 生命、物理和社会科学技术员
194099.title_ja: 生命、物理、社会科学技術者
194099.title_tl: Buhay, Pisikal, and Social Science Technician

195011.title: Occupational Health and Safety Specialist
195011.description: Review, evaluate, and analyze work environments and design programs and procedures to control, eliminate, and prevent disease or injury caused by chemical, physical, and biological agents or ergonomic factors. May conduct inspections and enforce adherence to laws and regulations governing the health and safety of individuals. May be employed in the public or private sector.
195011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
195011.title_es: Especialista en Salud y Seguridad Ocupacional
195011.title_ja: 労働安全衛生スペシャリスト
195011.title_tl: Espesyalista sa Kalusugan at Kaligtasan ng Trabaho

195012.title: Occupational Health and Safety Technician
195012.description: Collect data on work environments for analysis by occupational health and safety specialists. Implement and conduct evaluation of programs designed to limit chemical, physical, biological, and ergonomic risks to workers.
195012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
195012.title_es: Técnico en Salud y Seguridad Ocupacional
195012.title_zh: 职业健康与安全技术员
195012.title_tl: Technician ng Kalusugan at Kaligtasan ng Trabaho

211011.title: Substance Abuse and Behavioral Disorder Counselor
211011.official_title: Substance Abuse and Behavioral Disorder Counselors
211011.description: Counsel and advise individuals with alcohol, tobacco, drug, or other problems, such as gambling and eating disorders. May counsel individuals, families, or groups or engage in prevention programs.
211011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
211011.title_es: Consejero Especializado en Abuso de Sustancias y Trastornos del Comportamiento
211011.title_en: Substance Abuse and Behavioral Disorder Counselor
211011.title_zh: 药物滥用和行为障碍顾问
211011.title_ja: 薬物乱用・行動障害カウンセラー
211011.title_tl: Tagapayo sa Pag-abuso sa Sangkap at Pag-uugali ng Pag-uugali

211012.title: Educational, Guidance, and Career Counselor/Advisor
211012.official_title: Educational, Guidance, and Career Counselors and Advisors
211012.description: Advise and assist students and provide educational and vocational guidance services.
211012.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
211012.title_es: Consejero y Orientador Educativo, Académico, y Ocupacional
211012.title_zh: 教育、指导和职业顾问/顾问
211012.title_ja: 教育、指導、キャリアカウンセラー/アドバイザー
211012.title_tl: Pang-edukasyon, Patnubay, and Tagapayo sa Kareret/Tagapayo

211013.title: Marriage and Family Therapist
211013.description: Diagnose and treat mental and emotional disorders, whether cognitive, affective, or behavioral, within the context of marriage and family systems. Apply psychotherapeutic and family systems theories and techniques in the delivery of services to individuals, couples, and families for the purpose of treating such diagnosed nervous and mental disorders.
211013.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

211014.title: Mental Health Counselor
211014.description: Counsel and advise individuals and groups to promote optimum mental and emotional health, with an emphasis on prevention. May help individuals deal with a broad range of mental health issues, such as those associated with addictions and substance abuse; family, parenting, and marital problems; stress management; self-esteem; or aging.
211014.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
211014.title_ja: メンタルヘルスカウンセラー

211015.title: Rehabilitation Counselor
211015.description: Counsel individuals to maximize the independence and employability of persons coping with personal, social, and vocational difficulties that result from birth defects, illness, disease, accidents, aging, or the stress of daily life. Coordinate activities for residents of care and treatment facilities. Assess client needs and design and implement rehabilitation programs that may include personal and vocational counseling, training, and job placement.
211015.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
211015.title_ja: リハビリテーションカウンセラー

211019.title: Counselor
211019.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

211021.title: Child, Family, and School Social Worker
211021.official_title: Child, Family, and School Social Workers
211021.description: Provide social services and assistance to improve the social and psychological functioning of children and their families and to maximize the family well-being and the academic functioning of children. May assist parents, arrange adoptions, and find foster homes for abandoned or abused children. In schools, they address such problems as teenage pregnancy, misbehavior, and truancy. May also advise teachers.
211021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
211021.title_es: Trabajador Social Especializado en Temas de la Infancia, Familiares y Escolares
211021.title_en: Child, Family, and School Social Worker
211021.title_zh: 儿童、家庭和学校社会工作者
211021.title_ja: 子供、家族、学校ソーシャルワーカー
211021.title_tl: Bata, Pamilya, at Social Worker sa Paaralan

211022.title: Healthcare Social Worker
211022.description: Provide individuals, families, and groups with the psychosocial support needed to cope with chronic, acute, or terminal illnesses. Services include advising family caregivers. Provide patients with information and counseling, and make referrals for other services. May also provide case and care management or interventions designed to promote health, prevent disease, and address barriers to access to healthcare.
211022.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, Internship/residency
211022.title_es: Trabajador Social de Cuidado de la Salud
211022.title_ja: 医療ソーシャルワーカー

211023.title: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Worker
211023.official_title: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Workers
211023.description: Assess and treat individuals with mental, emotional, or substance abuse problems, including abuse of alcohol, tobacco, and/or other drugs. Activities may include individual and group therapy, crisis intervention, case management, client advocacy, prevention, and education.
211023.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, Internship/residency
211023.title_es: Trabajador Social Especializado en Salud Mental y Abuso de Sustancias
211023.title_en: Mental Health and Substance Abuse Social Worker
211023.title_zh: 心理健康和药物滥用社会工作者
211023.title_ja: メンタルヘルスと薬物乱用ソーシャルワーカー
211023.title_tl: Kalusugan ng Mental at Pag-abuso sa Sangkap Social Worker

211029.title: Social Worker
211029.description: All social workers not listed separately.
211029.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

211091.title: Health Education Specialist
211091.description: Provide and manage health education programs that help individuals, families, and their communities maximize and maintain healthy lifestyles. Use data to identify community needs prior to planning, implementing, monitoring, and evaluating programs designed to encourage healthy lifestyles, policies, and environments. May link health systems, health providers, insurers, and patients to address individual and population health needs. May serve as resource to assist individuals, other health professionals, or the community, and may administer fiscal resources for health education programs.
211091.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
211091.title_es: Especialista en Educación de la Salud
211091.title_ja: 保健教育スペシャリスト

211092.title: Probation Officer or Correctional Treatment Specialist
211092.official_title: Probation Officers and Correctional Treatment Specialists
211092.description: Provide social services to assist in rehabilitation of law offenders in custody or on probation or parole. Make recommendations for actions involving formulation of rehabilitation plan and treatment of offender, including conditional release and education and employment stipulations.
211092.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
211092.title_es: Oficial de Libertad Condicional o Especialista en Tratamiento Correccional
211092.title_en: Probation Officer or Correctional Treatment Specialist
211092.title_ja: 保護観察官または矯正治療専門医
211092.title_tl: Opisyal ng Probasyon o Espesyalista sa Pagwawasto

211093.title: Social and Human Service Assistant
211093.description: Assist other social and human service providers in providing client services in a wide variety of fields, such as psychology, rehabilitation, or social work, including support for families. May assist clients in identifying and obtaining available benefits and social and community services. May assist social workers with developing, organizing, and conducting programs to prevent and resolve problems relevant to substance abuse, human relationships, rehabilitation, or dependent care.
211093.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
211093.title_es: Asistente de Servicios Sociales y Humanos
211093.title_ja: 社会福祉アシスタント
211093.title_tl: Katulong sa Serbisyong Panlipunan at Tao

211094.title: Community Health Worker
211094.description: Promote health within a community by assisting individuals to adopt healthy behaviors. Serve as an advocate for the health needs of individuals by assisting community residents in effectively communicating with healthcare providers or social service agencies. Act as liaison or advocate and implement programs that promote, maintain, and improve individual and overall community health. May deliver health-related preventive services such as blood pressure, glaucoma, and hearing screenings. May collect data to help identify community health needs.
211094.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
211094.title_es: Trabajador de la Salud para la Comunidad

211099.title: Community and Social Service Specialist
211099.official_title: Community and Social Service Specialists, All Other
211099.description: All community and social service specialists not listed separately.
211099.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
211099.title_es: Especialista en Servicios Comunitarios y Sociales
211099.title_ja: 地域社会福祉スペシャリスト

212011.title: Clergy
212011.description: Conduct religious worship and perform other spiritual functions associated with beliefs and practices of religious faith or denomination. Provide spiritual and moral guidance and assistance to members.
212011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

212021.title: Religious Activities and Education Director
212021.description: Coordinate or design programs and conduct outreach to promote the religious education or activities of a denominational group. May provide counseling, guidance, and leadership relative to marital, health, financial, and religious problems.
212021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
212021.title_es: Director de Educación y Actividades Religiosas
212021.title_ja: 宗教活動・教育ディレクター
212021.title_tl: Direktor ng Mga Aktibidad sa Reli

212099.title: Religious Worker
212099.description: All religious workers not listed separately.
212099.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

231011.title: Lawyer
231011.description: Represent clients in criminal and civil litigation and other legal proceedings, draw up legal documents, or manage or advise clients on legal transactions. May specialize in a single area or may practice broadly in many areas of law.
231011.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

231012.title: Judicial Law Clerk
231012.description: Assist judges in court or by conducting research or preparing legal documents.
231012.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

231021.title: Administrative Law Judge/Adjudicator/Hearing Officer
231021.official_title: Administrative Law Judges, Adjudicators, and Hearing Officers
231021.description: Conduct hearings to recommend or make decisions on claims concerning government programs or other government-related matters. Determine liability, sanctions, or penalties, or recommend the acceptance or rejection of claims or settlements.
231021.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, 5 years or more work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
231021.title_es: Juez de Derecho Administrativo, Adjudicadores y Oficial de Audiencia
231021.title_zh: 行政法法官/裁判员/听证官
231021.title_ja: 行政法判事/裁定人/ヒアリングオフィサー

231022.title: Arbitrator/Mediator/Conciliator

252051.title: Special Education Teacher (Preschool)
252051.description: Teach academic, social, and life skills to preschool-aged students with learning, emotional, or physical disabilities. Includes teachers who specialize and work with students who are blind or have visual impairments; students who are deaf or have hearing impairments; and students with intellectual disabilities.
252051.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
252051.title_es: Maestro de Educación Especial de Nivel Preescolar
252051.title_ja: 特別教育教師 (プリスクール)

252055.title: Special Education Teacher (Kindergarten)
252055.description: Teach academic, social, and life skills to kindergarten students with learning, emotional, or physical disabilities. Includes teachers who specialize and work with students who are blind or have visual impairments; students who are deaf or have hearing impairments; and students with intellectual disabilities.
252055.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
252055.title_es: Maestro de Educación Especial de Jardín de Infantes

252056.title: Special Education Teacher (Elementary School)
252056.description: Teach academic, social, and life skills to elementary school students with learning, emotional, or physical disabilities. Includes teachers who specialize and work with students who are blind or have visual impairments; students who are deaf or have hearing impairments; and students with intellectual disabilities.
252056.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
252056.title_es: Maestro de Educación Especial de Escuela Primaria
252056.title_tl: Guro ng Espesyal na Edukasyon (Paaralang Elementarya)

252057.title: Special Education Teacher (Middle School)
252057.description: Teach academic, social, and life skills to middle school students with learning, emotional, or physical disabilities. Includes teachers who specialize and work with students who are blind or have visual impairments; students who are deaf or have hearing impairments; and students with intellectual disabilities.
252057.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
252057.title_es: Maestro de Educación Especial de Escuela de Nivel Medio
252057.title_tl: Guro ng Espesyal na Edukasyon (Gitnang Paaralan)

252058.title: Special Education Teacher (Secondary School)
252058.description: Teach academic, social, and life skills to secondary school students with learning, emotional, or physical disabilities. Includes teachers who specialize and work with students who are blind or have visual impairments; students who are deaf or have hearing impairments; and students with intellectual disabilities.
252058.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
252058.title_es: Maestro de Educación Especial de Escuela Secundaria
252058.title_ja: 特別教育教師 (中等学校)
252058.title_tl: Guro ng Espesyal na Edukasyon (Paaralang Pangalawang)

252059.title: Special Education Teacher
252059.description: All special education teachers not listed separately.
252059.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

253011.title: Adult Education Instructor
253011.official_title: Adult Basic Education, Adult Secondary Education, and English as a Second Language Instructors
253011.description: Teach or instruct out-of-school youths and adults in basic education, literacy, or English as a Second Language classes, or in classes for earning a high school equivalency credential.
253011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
253011.title_es: Instructores de Educación Básica para Adultos

253021.title: Self-Enrichment Teacher
253021.description: Teach or instruct individuals or groups for the primary purpose of self-enrichment or recreation, rather than for an occupational objective, educational attainment, competition, or fitness.
253021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
253021.title_ja: セルフエンリッチメント教師

253031.title: Substitute Teacher
253031.description: Teach students on a short-term basis as a temporary replacement for a regular classroom teacher, typically using the regular teacher’s lesson plan.
253031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

253041.title: Tutor
253041.description: Instruct individual students or small groups of students in academic subjects to support formal class instruction or to prepare students for standardized or admissions tests.
253041.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

253099.title: Teacher/Instructor
253099.description: All teachers and instructors not listed separately.
253099.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
253099.title_ja: 講師/インストラクター

254011.title: Archivist
254011.description: Appraise, edit, and direct safekeeping of permanent records and historically valuable documents. Participate in research activities based on archival materials.
254011.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

254012.title: Curator
254012.description: Administer collections, such as artwork, collectibles, historic items, or scientific specimens of museums or other institutions. May conduct instructional, research, or public service activities of institution.
254012.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

254013.title: Museum Technician/Conservator
254013.description: Restore, maintain, or prepare objects in museum collections for storage, research, or exhibit. May work with specimens such as fossils, skeletal parts, or botanicals; or artifacts, textiles, or art. May identify and record objects or install and arrange them in exhibits. Includes book or document conservators.
254013.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
254013.title_ja: ミュージアムテクニシャン/コンサベーター

254022.title: Librarian or Media Collections Specialist
254022.description: Administer and maintain libraries or collections of information, for public or private access through reference or borrowing. Work in a variety of settings, such as educational institutions, museums, and corporations, and with various types of informational materials, such as books, periodicals, recordings, films, and databases. Tasks may include acquiring, cataloging, and circulating library materials, and user services such as locating and organizing information, providing instruction on how to access information, and setting up and operating a library’s media equipment.
254022.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
254022.title_es: Bibliotecarios o Especialista en Colecciones de Materiales Multimedios
254022.title_zh: 图书馆员或媒体馆藏专家
254022.title_ja: ライブラリアンまたはメディアコレクションスペシャリスト
254022.title_tl: Dalubhasa sa Koleksyon ng Librarian o Media

254031.title: Library Technician
254031.description: Assist librarians by helping readers in the use of library catalogs, databases, and indexes to locate books and other materials; and by answering questions that require only brief consultation of standard reference. Compile records; sort and shelve books or other media; remove or repair damaged books or other media; register patrons; and check materials in and out of the circulation process. Replace materials in shelving area (stacks) or files. Includes bookmobile drivers who assist with providing services in mobile libraries.
254031.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

259021.title: Farm and Home Management Educator
259021.description: Instruct and advise individuals and families engaged in agriculture, agricultural-related processes, or home management activities. Demonstrate procedures and apply research findings to advance agricultural and home management activities. May develop educational outreach programs. May instruct on either agricultural issues such as agricultural processes and techniques, pest management, and food safety, or on home management issues such as budgeting, nutrition, and child development.
259021.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
259021.title_es: Educadores en Gerencia de Granjas y Hogares
259021.title_zh: 农场和家庭管理教育家
259021.title_ja: 農場と家庭経営の教育者
259021.title_tl: Tagapagturo ng Pamamahala ng Bukid at Tahanan

259031.title: Instructional Coordinator
259031.description: Develop instructional material, coordinate educational content, and incorporate current technology into instruction in order to provide guidelines to educators and instructors for developing curricula and conducting courses. May train and coach teachers. Includes educational consultants and specialists, and instructional material directors.
259031.typical_training: Master's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
259031.title_ja: インストラクショナル・コーディネーター

259042.title: Teaching Assistant (Preschool, Elementary, Middle, and Secondary School)
259042.official_title: Teaching Assistants, Preschool, Elementary, Middle, and Secondary School, Except Special Education
259042.description: Assist a preschool, elementary, middle, or secondary school teacher with instructional duties. Serve in a position for which a teacher has primary responsibility for the design and implementation of educational programs and services.
259042.typical_training: Some college, no degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
259042.title_es: Auxiliar Docente de Educación Preescolar, Primaria, Nivel Medio y Secundaria
259042.title_en: Teaching Assistant (Preschool, Elementary, Middle, and Secondary School)
259042.title_zh: 助教（幼儿园、小学、初中和中学）
259042.title_ja: ティーチングアシスタント（プリスクール、小学校、中学校、中学校）
259042.title_tl: Katulong sa Pagtuturo (Preschool, Elementarya, Gitnang, at Sekundaryong Paaralan)

259043.title: Special Education Teaching Assistant
259043.description: Assist a preschool, elementary, middle, or secondary school teacher to provide academic, social, or life skills to students who have learning, emotional, or physical disabilities. Serve in a position for which a teacher has primary responsibility for the design and implementation of educational programs and services.
259043.typical_training: Some college, no degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

259044.title: Teaching Assistant (Postsecondary)
259044.description: Assist faculty or other instructional staff in postsecondary institutions by performing instructional support activities, such as developing teaching materials, leading discussion groups, preparing and giving examinations, and grading examinations or papers. Graduate students who teach one or more full courses should be classified in the 25-1000 minor group.
259044.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
259044.title_ja: ティーチングアシスタント

259049.title: Teaching Assistant
259049.description: All teaching assistants not listed separately.
259049.typical_training: Some college, no degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

259099.title: Educational Instruction or Library Worker
259099.official_title: Educational Instruction and Library Workers, All Other
259099.description: All educational instruction and library workers not listed separately.
259099.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
259099.title_es: Trabajador de Ocupación Relacionadas con la Instrucción Educativa o Bibliotecología
259099.title_zh: 教育指导或图书馆工作人员
259099.title_ja: 教育指導または図書館員

271011.title: Art Director
271011.description: Formulate design concepts and presentation approaches for visual productions and media, such as print, broadcasting, video, and film. Direct workers engaged in artwork or layout design.
271011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training

271012.title: Craft Artist
271012.description: Create or reproduce handmade objects for sale and exhibition using a variety of techniques, such as welding, weaving, pottery, and needlecraft.
271012.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
271012.title_ja: クラフトアーティスト

271013.title: Fine Artist
271013.official_title: Fine Artists, Including Painters, Sculptors, and Illustrators
271013.description: Create original artwork using any of a wide variety of media and techniques.
271013.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
271013.title_ja: ファイン・アーティスト

271014.title: Special Effects Artist or Animator
271014.description: Create special effects or animations using film, video, computers, or other electronic tools and media for use in products, such as computer games, movies, music videos, and commercials.
271014.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
271014.title_es: Animador o Artista de Efectos Especiales
271014.title_ja: 特殊効果アーティストまたはアニメーター
271014.title_tl: Espesyal na Effects Artist o Animator

271019.title: Arts Occupation
271019.official_title: Artists and Related Workers, All Other
271019.description: All artists and related workers not listed separately.
271019.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

271021.title: Commercial/Industrial Designer
271021.description: Design and develop manufactured products, such as cars, home appliances, and children’s toys. Combine artistic talent with research on product use, marketing, and materials to create the most functional and appealing product design.
271021.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
271021.title_ja: コマーシャル/インダストリアルデザイナー

271022.title: Fashion Designer
271022.description: Design clothing and accessories. Create original designs or adapt fashion trends.
271022.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
271022.title_ja: ファッションデザイナー

271023.title: Floral Designer
271023.description: Design, cut, and arrange live, dried, or artificial flowers and foliage.
271023.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
271023.title_ja: フローラルデザイナー

271024.title: Graphic Designer
271024.description: Design or create graphics to meet specific commercial or promotional needs, such as packaging, displays, or logos. May use a variety of mediums to achieve artistic or decorative effects.
271024.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
271024.title_ja: グラフィックデザイナー

271025.title: Interior Designer
271025.description: Plan, design, and furnish the internal space of rooms or buildings. Design interior environments or create physical layouts that are practical, aesthetic, and conducive to the intended purposes. May specialize in a particular field, style, or phase of interior design.
271025.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
271025.title_ja: インテリアデザイナー

271026.title: Merchandise Displayer
271026.description: Plan and erect commercial displays, such as those in windows and interiors of retail stores and at trade exhibitions.
271026.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
271026.title_ja: 商品ディスプレイヤー

271027.title: Set and Exhibit Designers Designer
271027.description: Design special exhibits and sets for film, video, television, and theater productions. May study scripts, confer with directors, and conduct research to determine appropriate architectural styles.
271027.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
271027.title_zh: 布景和展览设计师设计师
271027.title_ja: セットと展示デザイナーデザイナー

271029.title: Designer
271029.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

272011.title: Actor
272011.description: Play parts in stage, television, radio, video, or film productions, or other settings for entertainment, information, or instruction. Interpret serious or comic role by speech, gesture, and body movement to entertain or inform audience. May dance and sing.
272011.typical_training: Some college, no degree, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

272012.title: Producer/Director
272012.description: Produce or direct stage, television, radio, video, or film productions for entertainment, information, or instruction. Responsible for creative decisions, such as interpretation of script, choice of actors or guests, set design, sound, special effects, and choreography.
272012.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
272012.title_ja: プロデューサー／ディレクター

272021.title: Athlete/Sports Competitor
272021.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
272021.title_ja: アスリート/スポーツ選手

272022.title: Coach/Scout
272022.description: Instruct or coach groups or individuals in the fundamentals of sports for the primary purpose of competition. Demonstrate techniques and methods of participation. May evaluate athletes’ strengths and weaknesses as possible recruits or to improve the athletes’ technique to prepare them for competition. Those required to hold teaching certifications should be reported in the appropriate teaching category.
272022.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

272023.title: Umpire, Referee, or Other Sports Official
272023.official_title: Umpires, Referees, and Other Sports Officials
272023.description: Officiate at competitive athletic or sporting events. Detect infractions of rules and decide penalties according to established regulations. Includes all sporting officials, referees, and competition judges.
272023.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
272023.title_en: Umpire, Referee, or Other Sports Official
272023.title_zh: 裁判员、裁判员或其他体育官员
272023.title_ja: 審判、審判、その他のスポーツ関係者
272023.title_tl: Umpire, Referee, o Iba Pang Sports Opisyal

272031.title: Dancer
272031.description: Perform dances. May perform on stage, for broadcasting, or for video recording.
272031.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

272032.title: Choreographer
272032.description: Create new dance routines. Rehearse performance of routines. May direct and stage presentations.
272032.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, 5 years or more work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

272041.title: Music Director/Composer
272041.description: Conduct, direct, plan, and lead instrumental or vocal performances by musical artists or groups, such as orchestras, bands, choirs, and glee clubs; or create original works of music.
272041.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

272042.title: Musician
272042.description: Play one or more musical instruments or sing. May perform on stage, for broadcasting, or for sound or video recording.
272042.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

272091.title: Disc Jockey
272091.description: Play prerecorded music for live audiences at venues or events such as clubs, parties, or wedding receptions. May use techniques such as mixing, cutting, or sampling to manipulate recordings. May also perform as emcee (master of ceremonies). Radio disc jockeys are included in “Broadcast Announcers and Radio Disc Jockeys”.
272091.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

272099.title: Entertainer/Performer
272099.official_title: Entertainers and Performers, Sports and Related Workers, All Other
272099.description: All entertainers and performers, sports and related workers not listed separately.
272099.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
272099.title_ja: エンターテイナー／パフォーマー

273011.title: Broadcast Announcer or Radio Disc Jockey
273011.official_title: Broadcast Announcers and Radio Disc Jockeys
273011.description: Speak or read from scripted materials, such as news reports or commercial messages, on radio, television, or other communications media. May play and queue music, announce artist or title of performance, identify station, or interview guests.
273011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
273011.title_es: Anunciadores de Medios de Difusión o Locutores de Radio
273011.title_en: Broadcast Announcer or Radio Disc Jockey
273011.title_zh: 广播播音员或电台唱片骑师
273011.title_ja: 放送アナウンサーまたはラジオディスクジョッキー
273011.title_tl: Tagapagbalita ng Broadcast o Radio Disc Jockey

273023.title: News Analysts, Reporters, and Journalist
273023.description: Narrate or write news stories, reviews, or commentary for print, broadcast, or other communications media such as newspapers, magazines, radio, or television. May collect and analyze information through interview, investigation, or observation.
273023.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
273023.title_es: Analista de Noticias, Reportero o Periodista
273023.title_zh: 新闻分析师、记者和记者
273023.title_ja: ニュースアナリスト、記者、ジャーナリスト

273031.title: Public Relations Specialist
273031.description: Promote or create an intended public image for individuals, groups, or organizations. May write or select material for release to various communications media. May specialize in using social media.
273031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

273041.title: Editor
273041.description: Plan, coordinate, revise, or edit written material. May review proposals and drafts for possible publication.
273041.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

273042.title: Technical Writer
273042.description: Write technical materials, such as equipment manuals, appendices, or operating and maintenance instructions. May assist in layout work.
273042.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

273043.title: Writer/Author
273043.description: Originate and prepare written material, such as scripts, stories, advertisements, and other material.
273043.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

273091.title: Interpreter/Translator
273091.description: Interpret oral or sign language, or translate written text from one language into another.
273091.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

273092.title: Court Reporter or Simultaneous Captioner
273092.description: Use verbatim methods and equipment to capture, store, retrieve, and transcribe pretrial and trial proceedings or other information. Includes stenocaptioners who operate computerized stenographic captioning equipment to provide captions of live or prerecorded broadcasts for hearing-impaired viewers.
273092.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
273092.title_es: Transcriptores Judiciales o Estenógrafos de Subtítulos en Tiempo Real
273092.title_ja: 裁判所記者または同時キャプショナー
273092.title_tl: Tagapag-ulat ng Korte o Sabay-sabay na Tagapangasiwa

273099.title: Media and Communication Worker
273099.official_title: Media and Communication Workers, All Other
273099.description: All media and communication workers not listed separately.
273099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
273099.title_es: Trabajador de Medios de Difusión y Comunicación
273099.title_ja: メディア・コミュニケーションワーカー

274011.title: Audio/Video Technician
274011.description: Set up, maintain, and dismantle audio and video equipment, such as microphones, sound speakers, connecting wires and cables, sound and mixing boards, video cameras, video monitors and servers, and related electronic equipment for live or recorded events, such as concerts, meetings, conventions, presentations, podcasts, news conferences, and sporting events.
274011.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
274011.title_ja: オーディオ/ビデオテクニシャン

274012.title: Broadcast Technician
274012.description: Set up, operate, and maintain the electronic equipment used to acquire, edit, and transmit audio and video for radio or television programs. Control and adjust incoming and outgoing broadcast signals to regulate sound volume, signal strength, and signal clarity. Operate satellite, microwave, or other transmitter equipment to broadcast radio or television programs.
274012.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

274014.title: Sound Engineering Technician
274014.description: Assemble and operate equipment to record, synchronize, mix, edit, or reproduce sound, including music, voices, or sound effects, for theater, video, film, television, podcasts, sporting events, and other productions.
274014.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
274014.title_ja: サウンドエンジニアリング技術者

274015.title: Lighting Technician
274015.description: Set up, maintain, and dismantle light fixtures, lighting control devices, and the associated lighting electrical and rigging equipment used for photography, television, film, video, and live productions. May focus or operate light fixtures, or attach color filters or other lighting accessories.
274015.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

274021.title: Photographer
274021.description: Photograph people, landscapes, merchandise, or other subjects. May use lighting equipment to enhance a subject’s appearance. May use editing software to produce finished images and prints. Includes commercial and industrial photographers, scientific photographers, and photojournalists.
274021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

274031.title: Camera Operator
274031.official_title: Camera Operators, Television, Video, and Film
274031.description: Operate television, video, or film camera to record images or scenes for television, video, or film productions.
274031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

274032.title: Film and Video Editor
274032.description: Edit moving images on film, video, or other media. May work with a producer or director to organize images for final production. May edit or synchronize soundtracks with images.
274032.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
274032.title_es: Editor de Películas Cinematográficas y Video
274032.title_ja: フィルム＆ビデオエディター

274099.title: Media and Communication Equipment Worker
274099.official_title: Media and Communication Equipment Workers, All Other
274099.description: All media and communication equipment workers not listed separately.
274099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
274099.title_es: Trabajador de Equipos de Medios de Difusión y Comunicación
274099.title_ja: メディア・通信機器作業員
274099.title_tl: Manggagawa ng Media at Komunikasyon Kagamitan

291011.title: Chiropractor
291011.description: Assess, treat, and care for patients by manipulation of spine and musculoskeletal system. May provide spinal adjustment or address sacral or pelvic misalignment.
291011.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291021.title: Dentist
291021.description: Examine, diagnose, and treat diseases, injuries, and malformations of teeth and gums. May treat diseases of nerve, pulp, and other dental tissues affecting oral hygiene and retention of teeth. May fit dental appliances or provide preventive care.
291021.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291022.title: Oral Surgeon
291022.description: Perform surgery and related procedures on the hard and soft tissues of the oral and maxillofacial regions to treat diseases, injuries, or defects. May diagnose problems of the oral and maxillofacial regions. May perform surgery to improve function or appearance.
291022.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291023.title: Orthodontist
291023.description: Examine, diagnose, and treat dental malocclusions and oral cavity anomalies. Design and fabricate appliances to realign teeth and jaws to produce and maintain normal function and to improve appearance.
291023.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291024.title: Prosthodontist
291024.description: Diagnose, treat, rehabilitate, design, and fit prostheses that maintain oral function, health, and appearance for patients with clinical conditions associated with teeth, oral and maxillofacial tissues, or the jaw.
291024.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291029.title: Dentist (Specialist)
291029.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291031.title: Dietitian and Nutritionist
291031.description: Plan and conduct food service or nutritional programs to assist in the promotion of health and control of disease. May supervise activities of a department providing quantity food services, counsel individuals, or conduct nutritional research.
291031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291041.title: Optometrist
291041.description: Diagnose, manage, and treat conditions and diseases of the human eye and visual system. Examine eyes and visual system, diagnose problems or impairments, prescribe corrective lenses, and provide treatment. May prescribe therapeutic drugs to treat specific eye conditions. Ophthalmologists are included in “Ophthalmologists, Except Pediatric”.
291041.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291051.title: Pharmacist
291051.description: Dispense drugs prescribed by physicians and other health practitioners and provide information to patients about medications and their use. May advise physicians and other health practitioners on the selection, dosage, interactions, and side effects of medications.
291051.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291071.title: Physician Assistant
291071.description: Provide healthcare services typically performed by a physician, under the supervision of a physician. Conduct complete physicals, provide treatment, and counsel patients. May, in some cases, prescribe medication. Must graduate from an accredited educational program for physician assistants.
291071.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291081.title: Podiatrist
291081.description: Diagnose and treat diseases and deformities of the human foot.
291081.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291122.title: Occupational Therapist
291122.description: Assess, plan, and organize rehabilitative programs that help build or restore vocational, homemaking, and daily living skills, as well as general independence, to persons with disabilities or developmental delays. Use therapeutic techniques, adapt the individual’s environment, teach skills, and modify specific tasks that present barriers to the individual.
291122.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291123.title: Physical Therapist
291123.description: Assess, plan, organize, and participate in rehabilitative programs that improve mobility, relieve pain, increase strength, and improve or correct disabling conditions resulting from disease or injury.
291123.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291124.title: Radiation Therapist
291124.description: Provide radiation therapy to patients as prescribed by a radiation oncologist according to established practices and standards. Duties may include reviewing prescription and diagnosis; acting as liaison with physician and supportive care personnel; preparing equipment, such as immobilization, treatment, and protection devices; and maintaining records, reports, and files. May assist in dosimetry procedures and tumor localization.
291124.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291125.title: Recreational Therapist
291125.description: Plan, direct, or coordinate medically-approved recreation programs for patients in hospitals, nursing homes, or other institutions. Activities include sports, trips, dramatics, social activities, and crafts. May assess a patient condition and recommend appropriate recreational activity.
291125.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
291125.title_ja: レクリエーションセラピスト

291126.title: Respiratory Therapist
291126.description: Assess, treat, and care for patients with breathing disorders. Assume primary responsibility for all respiratory care modalities, including the supervision of respiratory therapy technicians. Initiate and conduct therapeutic procedures; maintain patient records; and select, assemble, check, and operate equipment.
291126.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291127.title: Speech-Language Pathologist
291127.description: Assess and treat persons with speech, language, voice, and fluency disorders. May select alternative communication systems and teach their use. May perform research related to speech and language problems.
291127.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, Internship/residency
291127.title_es: Patólogo del Habla y el Lenguaje

291128.title: Exercise Physiologist
291128.description: Assess, plan, or implement fitness programs that include exercise or physical activities such as those designed to improve cardiorespiratory function, body composition, muscular strength, muscular endurance, or flexibility.
291128.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291129.title: Therapist
291129.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291131.title: Veterinarian
291131.description: Diagnose, treat, or research diseases and injuries of animals. Includes veterinarians who conduct research and development, inspect livestock, or care for pets and companion animals.
291131.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291141.title: Registered Nurse
291141.description: Assess patient health problems and needs, develop and implement nursing care plans, and maintain medical records. Administer nursing care to ill, injured, convalescent, or disabled patients. May advise patients on health maintenance and disease prevention or provide case management. Licensing or registration required. Includes Clinical Nurse Specialists.
291141.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291151.title: Nurse Anesthetist
291151.description: Administer anesthesia, monitor patient’s vital signs, and oversee patient recovery from anesthesia. May assist anesthesiologists, surgeons, other physicians, or dentists. Must be registered nurses who have specialized graduate education.
291151.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291161.title: Nurse Midwive
291161.description: Diagnose and coordinate all aspects of the birthing process, either independently or as part of a healthcare team. May provide well-woman gynecological care. Must have specialized, graduate nursing education.
291161.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291171.title: Nurse Practitioner
291171.description: Diagnose and treat acute, episodic, or chronic illness, independently or as part of a healthcare team. May focus on health promotion and disease prevention. May order, perform, or interpret diagnostic tests such as lab work and x rays. May prescribe medication. Must be registered nurses who have specialized graduate education.
291171.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
291171.title_ja: ナースプラクティショナー

291181.title: Audiologist
291181.description: Assess and treat persons with hearing and related disorders. May fit hearing aids and provide auditory training. May perform research related to hearing problems.
291181.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291211.title: Anesthesiologist
291211.description: Administer anesthetics and analgesics for pain management prior to, during, or after surgery.
291211.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291212.title: Cardiologist
291212.description: Diagnose, treat, manage, and prevent diseases or conditions of the cardiovascular system. May further subspecialize in interventional procedures (e.g., balloon angioplasty and stent placement), echocardiography, or electrophysiology.
291212.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291213.title: Dermatologist
291213.description: Diagnose and treat diseases relating to the skin, hair, and nails. May perform both medical and dermatological surgery functions.
291213.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291214.title: Emergency Medicine Physician
291214.description: Make immediate medical decisions and act to prevent death or further disability. Provide immediate recognition, evaluation, care, stabilization, and disposition of patients. May direct emergency medical staff in an emergency department.
291214.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency
291214.title_es: Médico Especialista en Medicina de Emergencias

291215.title: Family Medicine Physician
291215.description: Diagnose, treat, and provide preventive care to individuals and families across the lifespan. May refer patients to specialists when needed for further diagnosis or treatment.
291215.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291216.title: Internal Medicine Physician
291216.description: Diagnose and provide nonsurgical treatment for a wide range of diseases and injuries of internal organ systems. Provide care mainly for adults and adolescents, and are based primarily in an outpatient care setting.
291216.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291217.title: Neurologist
291217.description: Diagnose, manage, and treat disorders and diseases of the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral nerves, with a primarily nonsurgical focus.
291217.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291218.title: Obstetrician and Gynecologist
291218.description: Provide medical care related to pregnancy or childbirth. Diagnose, treat, and help prevent diseases of women, particularly those affecting the reproductive system. May also provide general care to women. May perform both medical and gynecological surgery functions.
291218.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291221.title: Pediatrician
291221.description: Diagnose, treat, and help prevent diseases and injuries in children. May refer patients to specialists for further diagnosis or treatment, as needed.
291221.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291222.title: Physician/Pathologist
291222.description: Diagnose diseases and conduct lab tests using organs, body tissues, and fluids. Includes medical examiners.
291222.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291223.title: Psychiatrist
291223.description: Diagnose, treat, and help prevent mental disorders.
291223.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291224.title: Radiologist
291224.description: Diagnose and treat diseases and injuries using medical imaging techniques, such as x rays, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), nuclear medicine, and ultrasounds. May perform minimally invasive medical procedures and tests.
291224.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291229.title: Physician
291229.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291241.title: Ophthalmologist
291241.description: Diagnose and perform surgery to treat and help prevent disorders and diseases of the eye. May also provide vision services for treatment including glasses and contacts.
291241.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291242.title: Orthopedic Surgeon
291242.description: Diagnose and perform surgery to treat and prevent rheumatic and other diseases in the musculoskeletal system.
291242.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291243.title: Pediatric Surgeon
291243.description: Diagnose and perform surgery to treat fetal abnormalities and birth defects, diseases, and injuries in fetuses, premature and newborn infants, children, and adolescents. Includes all pediatric surgical specialties and subspecialties.
291243.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291249.title: Surgeon
291249.typical_training: Doctoral or professional degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

291291.title: Acupuncturist
291291.description: Diagnose, treat, and prevent disorders by stimulating specific acupuncture points within the body using acupuncture needles. May also use cups, nutritional supplements, therapeutic massage, acupressure, and other alternative health therapies.
291291.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291292.title: Dental Hygienist
291292.description: Administer oral hygiene care to patients. Assess patient oral hygiene problems or needs and maintain health records. Advise patients on oral health maintenance and disease prevention. May provide advanced care such as providing fluoride treatment or administering topical anesthesia.
291292.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

291299.title: Healthcare Practitioner
291299.official_title: Healthcare Diagnosing or Treating Practitioners, All Other
291299.description: All healthcare diagnosing or treating practitioners not listed separately.
291299.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

292011.title: Medical/Clinical Laboratory Technologist
292011.description: Perform complex medical laboratory tests for diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease. May train or supervise staff.
292011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
292011.title_es: Tecnólogo de Laboratorio Médico y Clínico

292012.title: Medical/Clinical Laboratory Technician
292012.description: Perform routine medical laboratory tests for the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease. May work under the supervision of a medical technologist.
292012.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
292012.title_es: Técnico de Laboratorio Médico y Clínico
292012.title_zh: 医疗/临床实验室技术员

292031.title: Cardiovascular Technologist/Technician
292031.description: Conduct tests on pulmonary or cardiovascular systems of patients for diagnostic, therapeutic, or research purposes. May conduct or assist in electrocardiograms, cardiac catheterizations, pulmonary functions, lung capacity, and similar tests.
292031.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

292032.title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer
292032.description: Produce ultrasonic recordings of internal organs for use by physicians. Includes vascular technologists.
292032.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
292032.title_ja: 診断医療ソノグラファー

292033.title: Nuclear Medicine Technologist
292033.description: Prepare, administer, and measure radioactive isotopes in therapeutic, diagnostic, and tracer studies using a variety of radioisotope equipment. Prepare stock solutions of radioactive materials and calculate doses to be administered by radiologists. Subject patients to radiation. Execute blood volume, red cell survival, and fat absorption studies following standard laboratory techniques.
292033.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

292034.title: Radiologic Technologist/Technician
292034.description: Take x-rays and CAT scans or administer nonradioactive materials into patient’s bloodstream for diagnostic or research purposes. Includes radiologic technologists and technicians who specialize in other scanning modalities.
292034.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

292035.title: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Technologist
292035.description: Operate Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scanners. Monitor patient safety and comfort, and view images of area being scanned to ensure quality of pictures. May administer gadolinium contrast dosage intravenously. May interview patient, explain MRI procedures, and position patient on examining table. May enter into the computer data such as patient history, anatomical area to be scanned, orientation specified, and position of entry.
292035.typical_training: Associate's degree, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
292035.title_es: Tecnólogo Especializado en Imágenes de Resonancia Magnética
292035.title_ja: 磁気共鳴イメージング技術者

292036.title: Medical Dosimetrist
292036.description: Generate radiation treatment plans, develop radiation dose calculations, communicate and supervise the treatment plan implementation, and consult with members of radiation oncology team.
292036.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

292042.title: Emergency Medical Technician
292042.description: Assess injuries and illnesses and administer basic emergency medical care. May transport injured or sick persons to medical facilities.
292042.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

292043.title: Paramedic
292043.description: Administer basic or advanced emergency medical care and assess injuries and illnesses. May administer medication intravenously, use equipment such as EKGs, or administer advanced life support to sick or injured individuals.
292043.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

292051.title: Dietetic Technician
292051.description: Assist in the provision of food service and nutritional programs, under the supervision of a dietitian. May plan and produce meals based on established guidelines, teach principles of food and nutrition, or counsel individuals.
292051.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

292052.title: Pharmacy Technician
292052.description: Prepare medications under the direction of a pharmacist. May measure, mix, count out, label, and record amounts and dosages of medications according to prescription orders.
292052.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

292053.title: Psychiatric Technician
292053.description: Care for individuals with mental or emotional conditions or disabilities, following the instructions of physicians or other health practitioners. Monitor patients’ physical and emotional well-being and report to medical staff. May participate in rehabilitation and treatment programs, help with personal hygiene, and administer oral or injectable medications.
292053.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, Less than 5 years work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

292055.title: Surgical Technologist
292055.description: Assist in operations, under the supervision of surgeons, registered nurses, or other surgical personnel. May help set up operating room, prepare and transport patients for surgery, adjust lights and equipment, pass instruments and other supplies to surgeons and surgeons’ assistants, hold retractors, cut sutures, and help count sponges, needles, supplies, and instruments.
292055.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

292056.title: Veterinary Technologist/Technician
292056.description: Perform medical tests in a laboratory environment for use in the treatment and diagnosis of diseases in animals. Prepare vaccines and serums for prevention of diseases. Prepare tissue samples, take blood samples, and execute laboratory tests, such as urinalysis and blood counts. Clean and sterilize instruments and materials and maintain equipment and machines. May assist a veterinarian during surgery.
292056.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

292057.title: Ophthalmic Medical Technician
292057.description: Assist ophthalmologists by performing ophthalmic clinical functions. May administer eye exams, administer eye medications, and instruct the patient in care and use of corrective lenses.
292057.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

292061.title: Licensed Practical or Licensed Vocational Nurse
292061.official_title: Licensed Practical and Licensed Vocational Nurses
292061.description: Care for ill, injured, or convalescing patients or persons with disabilities in hospitals, nursing homes, clinics, private homes, group homes, and similar institutions. May work under the supervision of a registered nurse. Licensing required.
292061.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training
292061.title_es: Enfermero Práctico o Vocacional con Licencia
292061.title_en: Licensed Practical or Licensed Vocational Nurse
292061.title_zh: 持牌执业或持牌职业护士
292061.title_ja: 実務看護師または資格を有する職業看護師
292061.title_tl: Lisensyadong Praktikal o Lisensyadong Bokasyonal na Nurse

292072.title: Medical Records Specialist
292072.description: Compile, process, and maintain medical records of hospital and clinic patients in a manner consistent with medical, administrative, ethical, legal, and regulatory requirements of the healthcare system. Classify medical and healthcare concepts, including diagnosis, procedures, medical services, and equipment, into the healthcare industry’s numerical coding system. Includes medical coders.
292072.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training
292072.title_ja: 医療記録スペシャリスト

292081.title: Optician
292081.description: Design, measure, fit, and adapt lenses and frames for client according to written optical prescription or specification. Assist client with inserting, removing, and caring for contact lenses. Assist client with selecting frames. Measure customer for size of eyeglasses and coordinate frames with facial and eye measurements and optical prescription. Prepare work order for optical laboratory containing instructions for grinding and mounting lenses in frames. Verify exactness of finished lens spectacles. Adjust frame and lens position to fit client. May shape or reshape frames. Includes contact lens opticians.
292081.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

292091.title: Orthotist/Prosthetist
292091.description: Design, measure, fit, and adapt orthopedic braces, appliances or prostheses, such as limbs or facial parts for patients with disabling conditions.
292091.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, Internship/residency

292092.title: Hearing Aid Specialist
292092.description: Select and fit hearing aids for customers. Administer and interpret tests of hearing. Assess hearing instrument efficacy. Take ear impressions and prepare, design, and modify ear molds.
292092.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
292092.title_ja: 補聴器スペシャリスト

292099.title: Health Technologist/Technician
292099.official_title: Health Technologists and Technicians, All Other
292099.description: All health technologists and technicians not listed separately.
292099.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

299021.title: Health Information Technologist or Medical Registrar
299021.official_title: Health Information Technologists and Medical Registrars
299021.description: Apply knowledge of healthcare and information systems to assist in the design, development, and continued modification and analysis of computerized healthcare systems. Abstract, collect, and analyze treatment and followup information of patients. May educate staff and assist in problem solving to promote the implementation of the healthcare information system. May design, develop, test, and implement databases with complete history, diagnosis, treatment, and health status to help monitor diseases.
299021.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training
299021.title_es: Tecnólogo de Información de la Salud y Registradores Médico
299021.title_en: Health Information Technologist or Medical Registrar
299021.title_zh: 健康信息技师或医疗注册官
299021.title_ja: 医療情報技術者または医療登録機関
299021.title_tl: Teknolohista ng Impormasyon sa Kalusugan o Tagapagtala

299091.title: Athletic Trainer
299091.description: Evaluate and treat musculoskeletal injuries or illnesses. Provide preventive, therapeutic, emergency, and rehabilitative care.
299091.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
299091.title_ja: アスレティックトレーナー

299092.title: Genetic Counselor
299092.description: Assess individual or family risk for a variety of inherited conditions, such as genetic disorders and birth defects. Provide information to other healthcare providers or to individuals and families concerned with the risk of inherited conditions. Advise individuals and families to support informed decisionmaking and coping methods for those at risk. May help conduct research related to genetic conditions or genetic counseling.
299092.typical_training: Master's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

299093.title: Surgical Assistant
299093.description: Assist in operations, under the supervision of surgeons. May, in accordance with state laws, help surgeons to make incisions and close surgical sites, manipulate or remove tissues, implant surgical devices or drains, suction the surgical site, place catheters, clamp or cauterize vessels or tissue, and apply dressings to surgical site.
299093.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

299099.title: Healthcare Practitioner/Technical Worker
299099.official_title: Healthcare Practitioners and Technical Workers, All Other
299099.description: All healthcare practitioners and technical workers not listed separately.
299099.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training
299099.title_es: Trabajador de Ocupación Profesionales o Técnicas Relacionadas
299099.title_zh: 医疗保健从业人员/技术工作者
299099.title_tl: Propesyonal sa Pangangalagang Pangangalaga sa Kalusugan

311121.title: Home Health Aide
311121.description: Monitor the health status of an individual with disabilities or illness, and address their health-related needs, such as changing bandages, dressing wounds, or administering medication. Work is performed under the direction of offsite or intermittent onsite licensed nursing staff. Provide assistance with routine healthcare tasks or activities of daily living, such as feeding, bathing, toileting, or ambulation. May also help with tasks such as preparing meals, doing light housekeeping, and doing laundry depending on the patient’s abilities.
311121.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
311121.title_es: Auxiliar de Atención en el Hogar

311122.title: Personal Care Aide
311122.description: Provide personalized assistance to individuals with disabilities or illness who require help with personal care and activities of daily living support (e.g., feeding, bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, and ambulation). May also provide help with tasks such as preparing meals, doing light housekeeping, and doing laundry. Work is performed in various settings depending on the needs of the care recipient and may include locations such as their home, place of work, out in the community, or at a daytime nonresidential facility.
311122.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
311122.title_ja: パーソナルケア補佐官

311131.title: Nursing Assistant
311131.description: Provide or assist with basic care or support under the direction of onsite licensed nursing staff. Perform duties such as monitoring of health status, feeding, bathing, dressing, grooming, toileting, or ambulation of patients in a health or nursing facility. May include medication administration and other health-related tasks. Includes nursing care attendants, nursing aides, and nursing attendants.
311131.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

311132.title: Orderly
311132.description: Transport patients to areas such as operating rooms or x-ray rooms using wheelchairs, stretchers, or moveable beds. May maintain stocks of supplies or clean and transport equipment.
311132.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

311133.title: Psychiatric Aide
311133.description: Assist mentally impaired or emotionally disturbed patients, working under direction of nursing and medical staff. May assist with daily living activities, lead patients in educational and recreational activities, or accompany patients to and from examinations and treatments. May restrain violent patients. Includes psychiatric orderlies.
311133.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

312011.title: Occupational Therapy Assistant
312011.description: Assist occupational therapists in providing occupational therapy treatments and procedures. May, in accordance with state laws, assist in development of treatment plans, carry out routine functions, direct activity programs, and document the progress of treatments. Generally requires formal training.
312011.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training
312011.title_ja: 作業療法アシスタント

312012.title: Occupational Therapy Aide
312012.description: Under close supervision of an occupational therapist or occupational therapy assistant, perform only delegated, selected, or routine tasks in specific situations. These duties include preparing patient and treatment room.
312012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

312021.title: Physical Therapist Assistant
312021.description: Assist physical therapists in providing physical therapy treatments and procedures. May, in accordance with state laws, assist in the development of treatment plans, carry out routine functions, document the progress of treatment, and modify specific treatments in accordance with patient status and within the scope of treatment plans established by a physical therapist. Generally requires formal training.
312021.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

312022.title: Physical Therapist Aide
312022.description: Under close supervision of a physical therapist or physical therapy assistant, perform only delegated, selected, or routine tasks in specific situations. These duties include preparing the patient and the treatment area.
312022.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

319011.title: Massage Therapist
319011.description: Perform therapeutic massages of soft tissues and joints. May assist in the assessment of range of motion and muscle strength, or propose client therapy plans.
319011.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training
319011.title_ja: マッサージセラピスト

319091.title: Dental Assistant
319091.description: Perform limited clinical duties under the direction of a dentist. Clinical duties may include equipment preparation and sterilization, preparing patients for treatment, assisting the dentist during treatment, and providing patients with instructions for oral healthcare procedures. May perform administrative duties such as scheduling appointments, maintaining medical records, billing, and coding information for insurance purposes.
319091.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

319092.title: Medical Assistant
319092.description: Perform administrative and certain clinical duties under the direction of a physician. Administrative duties may include scheduling appointments, maintaining medical records, billing, and coding information for insurance purposes. Clinical duties may include taking and recording vital signs and medical histories, preparing patients for examination, drawing blood, and administering medications as directed by physician.
319092.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

319093.title: Medical Equipment Preparer
319093.description: Prepare, sterilize, install, or clean laboratory or healthcare equipment. May perform routine laboratory tasks and operate or inspect equipment.
319093.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

319094.title: Medical Transcriptionist
319094.description: Transcribe medical reports recorded by physicians and other healthcare practitioners using various electronic devices, covering office visits, emergency room visits, diagnostic imaging studies, operations, chart reviews, and final summaries. Transcribe dictated reports and translate abbreviations into fully understandable form. Edit as necessary and return reports in either printed or electronic form for review and signature, or correction.
319094.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

319095.title: Pharmacy Aide
319095.description: Record drugs delivered to the pharmacy, store incoming merchandise, and inform the supervisor of stock needs. May operate cash register and accept prescriptions for filling.
319095.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

319096.title: Veterinary Assistant or Laboratory Animal Caretaker
319096.official_title: Veterinary Assistants and Laboratory Animal Caretakers
319096.description: Feed, water, and examine pets and other nonfarm animals for signs of illness, disease, or injury in laboratories and animal hospitals and clinics. Clean and disinfect cages and work areas, and sterilize laboratory and surgical equipment. May provide routine postoperative care, administer medication orally or topically, or prepare samples for laboratory examination under the supervision of veterinary or laboratory animal technologists or technicians, veterinarians, or scientists.
319096.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
319096.title_es: Asistente de Veterinarios y Cuidador de Animales de Laboratorio
319096.title_en: Veterinary Assistant or Laboratory Animal Caretaker
319096.title_zh: 兽医助理或实验动物看护人
319096.title_ja: 獣医助手または実験動物管理人
319096.title_tl: Beterinaryo Assistant o Laboratory Animal Caretaker

319097.title: Phlebotomist
