319097.description: Draw blood for tests, transfusions, donations, or research. May explain the procedure to patients and assist in the recovery of patients with adverse reactions.
319097.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

319099.title: Healthcare Support Worker
319099.description: All healthcare support workers not listed separately.
319099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, No on-the-job training
319099.title_es: Trabajador de Ocupación de Apoyo (Cuidado de la Salud)

331011.title: Supervisor of Correctional Officers
331011.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of correctional officers and jailers.
331011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
331011.title_tl: Superbisor ng Mga Opisyal ng Pagwawasto

331012.title: Supervisor of Police and Detectives
331012.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Police and Detectives
331012.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of members of police force.
331012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
331012.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Policías y Detectives

331021.title: Supervisor of Firefighting and Prevention Workers
331021.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Firefighting and Prevention Workers
331021.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of workers engaged in firefighting and fire prevention and control.
331021.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, Less than 5 years work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
331021.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Trabajadores de Extinción y Prevención de Incendios
331021.title_en: Supervisor of Firefighting and Prevention Workers
331021.title_zh: 消防和预防工作者主管
331021.title_ja: 消防・予防従事者の監督者
331021.title_tl: Superbisor ng Mga Manggagawa sa Pag-iwas sa Pag-firefighting at Pre

331091.title: Supervisor of Security Workers
331091.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of security workers and security guards.
331091.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
331091.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Trabajadores de Seguridad
331091.title_ja: セキュリティワーカーのスーパーバイザー
331091.title_tl: Superbisor ng mga Manggagawa sa Seguridad

331099.title: Supervisor of Protective Service Workers
331099.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Protective Service Workers, All Other
331099.description: All protective service supervisors not listed separately above.
331099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
331099.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Trabajadores de Servicios de Protección
331099.title_ja: 保護サービス労働者の監督者
331099.title_tl: Superbisor ng Mga Manggagawa sa Serbisyo ng Pro

332011.title: Firefighter
332011.description: Control and extinguish fires or respond to emergency situations where life, property, or the environment is at risk. Duties may include fire prevention, emergency medical service, hazardous material response, search and rescue, and disaster assistance.
332011.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

332021.title: Fire Inspector/Investigator
332021.description: Inspect buildings to detect fire hazards and enforce local ordinances and state laws, or investigate and gather facts to determine cause of fires and explosions.
332021.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, 5 years or more work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

332022.title: Forest Fire Inspector/Prevention Specialist
332022.official_title: Forest Fire Inspectors and Prevention Specialists
332022.description: Enforce fire regulations, inspect forest for fire hazards, and recommend forest fire prevention or control measures. May report forest fires and weather conditions.
332022.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
332022.title_es: Inspector/Especialista en Prevención de Incendios Forestales
332022.title_zh: 森林消防督察员/预防专家
332022.title_ja: 森林火災検査官/予防スペシャリスト
332022.title_tl: Espesyalista sa Pag-iwas sa Sunog sa Forest Fire

333011.title: Bailiff
333011.description: Maintain order in courts of law.
333011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

333012.title: Correctional Officer
333012.description: Guard inmates in penal or rehabilitative institutions in accordance with established regulations and procedures. May guard prisoners in transit between jail, courtroom, prison, or other point. Includes deputy sheriffs and police who spend the majority of their time guarding prisoners in correctional institutions.
333012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

333021.title: Detective or Criminal Investigator
333021.description: Conduct investigations related to suspected violations of federal, state, or local laws to prevent or solve crimes.
333021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
333021.title_ja: 刑事または犯罪捜査官

333031.title: Fish and Game Warden
333031.description: Patrol assigned area to prevent fish and game law violations. Investigate reports of damage to crops or property by wildlife. Compile biological data.
333031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
333031.title_ja: 魚とゲームウォーデン

333041.title: Parking Enforcement Worker
333041.description: Patrol assigned area, such as public parking lot or city streets to issue tickets to overtime parking violators and illegally parked vehicles.
333041.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
333041.title_es: Guardia Controlador de Reglas de Estacionamiento

333051.title: Police or Sheriff Patrol Officer
333051.description: Maintain order and protect life and property by enforcing local, tribal, state, or federal laws and ordinances. Perform a combination of the following duties: patrol a specific area; direct traffic; issue traffic summonses; investigate accidents; apprehend and arrest suspects, or serve legal processes of courts. Includes police officers working at educational institutions.
333051.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
333051.title_ja: 警察または保安官パトロールオフィサー
333051.title_tl: Opisyal ng Patrol ng Pulisya o Sheriff

333052.title: Transit or Railroad Police
333052.description: Protect and police railroad and transit property, employees, or passengers.
333052.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
333052.title_es: Policía de Tránsito o Policías Ferroviario
333052.title_ja: 交通警察または鉄道警察

339011.title: Animal Control Worker
339011.description: Handle animals for the purpose of investigations of mistreatment, or control of abandoned, dangerous, or unattended animals.
339011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

339021.title: Private Detective/Investigator
339021.description: Gather, analyze, compile, and report information regarding individuals or organizations to clients, or detect occurrences of unlawful acts or infractions of rules in private establishment.
339021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

339031.title: Gambling Surveillance Officer/Investigator
339031.official_title: Gambling Surveillance Officers and Gambling Investigators
339031.description: Observe gambling operation for irregular activities such as cheating or theft by either employees or patrons. Investigate potential threats to gambling assets such as money, chips, and gambling equipment. Act as oversight and security agent for management and customers.
339031.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
339031.title_es: Agente/Investigador de Vigilancia de Salas de Juego
339031.title_ja: ギャンブル監視官/捜査官

339032.title: Security Guard
339032.description: Guard, patrol, or monitor premises to prevent theft, violence, or infractions of rules. May operate x-ray and metal detector equipment.
339032.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

339091.title: Crossing Guard/Flagger
339091.description: Guide or control vehicular or pedestrian traffic at such places as streets, schools, railroad crossings, or construction sites.
339091.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
339091.title_ja: クロッシングガード/フラッガー

339092.title: Recreational Protective Worker (Lifeguard, Ski Patrol)
339092.official_title: Lifeguards, Ski Patrol, and Other Recreational Protective Service Workers
339092.description: Monitor recreational areas, such as pools, beaches, or ski slopes, to provide assistance and protection to participants.
339092.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
339092.title_zh: 娱乐保护工作者（救生员、滑雪巡逻队）
339092.title_ja: レクリエーション保護作業員（ライフガード、スキーパトロール）
339092.title_tl: Libangan Proteksiyon ng Manggagawa (Tagapagsagip, Patrol ng Ski)

339093.title: Transportation Security Screener
339093.description: Conduct screening of passengers, baggage, or cargo to ensure compliance with Transportation Security Administration (TSA) regulations. May operate basic security equipment such as x-ray machines and hand wands at screening checkpoints.
339093.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
339093.title_es: Agente de la Seguridad en el Transporte
339093.title_ja: 交通セキュリティスクリーナー

339094.title: School Bus Monitor
339094.description: Maintain order among students on a school bus. Duties include helping students safely board and exit and communicating behavioral problems. May perform pretrip and posttrip inspections and prepare for and assist in emergency evacuations.
339094.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
339094.title_ja: スクールバスモニター

339099.title: Protective Service Worker
339099.description: All protective service workers not listed separately.
339099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
339099.title_ja: 保護サービスワーカー

351011.title: Chef or Head Cook
351011.description: Direct and may participate in the preparation, seasoning, and cooking of salads, soups, fish, meats, vegetables, desserts, or other foods. May plan and price menu items, order supplies, and keep records and accounts.
351011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
351011.title_ja: シェフまたはヘッドクック

351012.title: Supervisor of Food Preparation and Serving Workers
351012.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Food Preparation and Serving Workers
351012.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of workers engaged in preparing and serving food.
351012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
351012.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Trabajadores de Preparación y Servicio de Comidas
351012.title_en: Supervisor of Food Preparation and Serving Workers
351012.title_zh: 食品制备和服务工人主管
351012.title_ja: 食品の準備とサービングワーカーのスーパーバイザー
351012.title_tl: Superbisor ng Paghahanda ng Pagkain at Paglilingkod sa mga

352011.title: Fast Food Cook
352011.description: Prepare and cook food in a fast food restaurant with a limited menu. Duties of these cooks are limited to preparation of a few basic items and normally involve operating large-volume single-purpose cooking equipment.
352011.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
352011.title_ja: ファーストフードクック

352012.title: Institution/Cafeteria Cook
352012.description: Prepare and cook large quantities of food for institutions, such as schools, hospitals, or cafeterias.
352012.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
352012.title_ja: 施設/カフェテリアクック

352013.title: Private Cook
352013.description: Prepare meals in private homes. Includes personal chefs.
352013.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

352014.title: Restaurant Cook
352014.description: Prepare, season, and cook dishes such as soups, meats, vegetables, or desserts in restaurants. May order supplies, keep records and accounts, price items on menu, or plan menu.
352014.typical_training: No formal educational credential, Less than 5 years work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

352015.title: Short Order Cook
352015.description: Prepare and cook to order a variety of foods that require only a short preparation time. May take orders from customers and serve patrons at counters or tables.
352015.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
352015.title_es: Cocinero de Platos de Preparación Sencilla
352015.title_ja: ショートオーダークック

352019.title: Cook
352019.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

352021.title: Food Preparation Worker
352021.description: Perform a variety of food preparation duties other than cooking, such as preparing cold foods and shellfish, slicing meat, and brewing coffee or tea.
352021.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

353011.title: Bartender
353011.description: Mix and serve drinks to patrons, directly or through waitstaff.
353011.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

353023.title: Fast Food or Counter Worker
353023.description: Perform duties such as taking orders and serving food and beverages. Serve customers at counter or from a steam table. May take payment. May prepare food and beverages. Counter attendants who also wait tables are included in “Waiters and Waitresses”.
353023.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
353023.title_es: Trabajador de Comidas Rápidas y Dependientes de Mostrador
353023.title_zh: 快餐店或柜台工作人员
353023.title_ja: ファーストフードまたはカウンターワーカー
353023.title_tl: Mabilis na Pagkain o Kontra Worker

353031.title: Waiter/Waitress
353031.description: Take orders and serve food and beverages to patrons at tables in dining establishment.
353031.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
353031.title_ja: ウェイター/ウエイトレス

353041.title: Nonrestaurant Food Server
353041.description: Serve food to individuals outside of a restaurant environment, such as in hotel rooms, hospital rooms, residential care facilities, or cars.
353041.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
353041.title_ja: レストラン以外フードサーバー

359011.title: Dining Room and Cafeteria Attendant
359011.official_title: Dining Room and Cafeteria Attendants and Bartender Helpers
359011.description: Facilitate food service. Clean tables; remove dirty dishes; replace soiled table linens; set tables; replenish supply of clean linens, silverware, glassware, and dishes; supply service bar with food; and serve items such as water, condiments, and coffee to patrons.
359011.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
359011.title_es: Auxiliar de Salón Comedor/Ayudante de Cantineros
359011.title_zh: 餐厅和自助餐厅服务员
359011.title_ja: ダイニングルームとカフェテリアアテンダント

359021.title: Dishwasher
359021.description: Clean dishes, kitchen, food preparation equipment, or utensils.
359021.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

359031.title: Host/Hostess (Restaurant, Lounge, Coffee Shop)
359031.official_title: Hosts and Hostesses, Restaurant, Lounge, and Coffee Shop
359031.description: Welcome patrons, seat them at tables or in lounge, and help ensure quality of facilities and service.
359031.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
359031.title_zh: 主持人/女主人（餐厅、休息室、咖啡厅）
359031.title_ja: ホスト／ホステス（レストラン、ラウンジ、コーヒーショップ）

359099.title: Food Preparation and Serving Worker
359099.official_title: Food Preparation and Serving Related Workers, All Other
359099.description: All food preparation and serving related workers not listed separately.
359099.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
359099.title_es: Trabajador Relacionado con la Preparación y Servicio de Comidas
359099.title_ja: 食品の準備とサービングワーカー

371011.title: Supervisor of Housekeeping and Janitorial Workers
371011.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Housekeeping and Janitorial Workers
371011.description: Directly supervise and coordinate work activities of cleaning personnel in hotels, hospitals, offices, and other establishments.
371011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
371011.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Empleados Domésticos y de Limpieza
371011.title_en: Supervisor of Housekeeping and Janitorial Workers
371011.title_ja: ハウスキーピングおよび清掃作業員のスーパーバイザー
371011.title_tl: Superbisor ng Mga Manggagawa sa Bahay at Janitorial

371012.title: Supervisor of Landscaping, Lawn Service, and Groundskeeping Workers
371012.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Landscaping, Lawn Service, and Groundskeeping Workers
371012.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of workers engaged in landscaping or groundskeeping activities. Work may involve reviewing contracts to ascertain service, machine, and workforce requirements; answering inquiries from potential customers regarding methods, material, and price ranges; and preparing estimates according to labor, material, and machine costs.
371012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
371012.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Trabajadores de Jardinería, Mantenimiento de Césped y Terrenos
371012.title_en: Supervisor of Landscaping, Lawn Service, and Groundskeeping Workers
371012.title_zh: 园林绿化、草坪服务和地勤工作人员主管
371012.title_ja: 造園、芝生サービス、およびグラウンドキーピング作業員のスーパーバイザー
371012.title_tl: Superbisor ng Landscaping, Lawn Serbisyo, at Groundskeeping Workers

372011.title: Janitor/Cleaner
372011.official_title: Janitors and Cleaners, Except Maids and Housekeeping Cleaners
372011.description: Keep buildings in clean and orderly condition. Perform heavy cleaning duties, such as cleaning floors, shampooing rugs, washing walls and glass, and removing rubbish. Duties may include tending furnace and boiler, performing routine maintenance activities, notifying management of need for repairs, and cleaning snow or debris from sidewalk.
372011.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

372012.title: Maid/Housekeeping Cleaner
372012.description: Perform any combination of light cleaning duties to maintain private households or commercial establishments, such as hotels and hospitals, in a clean and orderly manner. Duties may include making beds, replenishing linens, cleaning rooms and halls, and vacuuming.
372012.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
372012.title_es: Empleado Doméstico/Personal de Limpieza de Casas Privadas
372012.title_ja: メイド/ハウスキーピングクリーナー

372019.title: Building Cleaning Worker
372019.description: All building cleaning workers not listed separately.
372019.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
372019.title_ja: ビルクリーニング作業員

372021.title: Pest Control Worker
372021.description: Apply or release chemical solutions or toxic gases and set traps to kill or remove pests and vermin that infest buildings and surrounding areas.
372021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
372021.title_es: Trabajador de Control y Exterminación de Plagas

373011.title: Landscaping/Groundskeeping Worker
373011.description: Landscape or maintain grounds of property using hand or power tools or equipment. Workers typically perform a variety of tasks, which may include any combination of the following: sod laying, mowing, trimming, planting, watering, fertilizing, digging, raking, sprinkler installation, and installation of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units.
373011.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
373011.title_es: Trabajador de Jardinería y Áreas Verdes
373011.title_ja: 造園・グラウンドキーピング作業員

373012.title: Pesticide Handler, Sprayer, or Applicator
373012.official_title: Pesticide Handlers, Sprayers, and Applicators, Vegetation
373012.description: Mix or apply pesticides, herbicides, fungicides, or insecticides through sprays, dusts, vapors, soil incorporation, or chemical application on trees, shrubs, lawns, or crops. Usually requires specific training and state or federal certification. Crop dusters are included in “Commercial Pilots”.
373012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
373012.title_es: Operador, Fumigadores o Aplicadores de Pesticidas
373012.title_zh: 农药处理器、喷雾器或施药器
373012.title_ja: 農薬ハンドラー、噴霧器、またはアプリケーター

373013.title: Tree Trimmer/Pruner
373013.description: Using sophisticated climbing and rigging techniques, cut away dead or excess branches from trees or shrubs to maintain right-of-way for roads, sidewalks, or utilities, or to improve appearance, health, and value of tree. Prune or treat trees or shrubs using handsaws, hand pruners, clippers, and power pruners. Works off the ground in the tree canopy and may use truck-mounted lifts.
373013.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
373013.title_ja: ツリートリマー/プルーナー

373019.title: Grounds Maintenance Worker
373019.description: All grounds maintenance workers not listed separately.
373019.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
373019.title_es: Trabajador de Mantenimiento de Áreas Verdes

391013.title: Supervisor of Gambling Services Worker
391013.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Gambling Services Workers
391013.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of workers in assigned gambling areas. May circulate among tables, observe operations, and ensure that stations and games are covered for each shift. May verify and pay off jackpots. May reset slot machines after payoffs and make repairs or adjustments to slot machines or recommend removal of slot machines for repair. May plan and organize activities and services for guests in hotels/casinos.
391013.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
391013.title_es: Supervisor de Trabajadores de Salas de Juego
391013.title_ja: ギャンブルサービスワーカーのスーパーバイザー
391013.title_tl: Superbisor ng Worker Serbisyo sa Pagsusugal

391014.title: Supervisor of Entertainment and Recreation Workers
391014.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Entertainment and Recreation Workers, Except Gambling Services
391014.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of entertainment and recreation related workers.
391014.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
391014.title_es: Supervisor de Trabajadores de Entretenimiento y Recreación
391014.title_en: Supervisor of Entertainment and Recreation Workers
391014.title_zh: 娱乐和娱乐工作者主管
391014.title_ja: エンターテイメントとレクリエーションの労働者のスーパーバイザー
391014.title_tl: Superbisor ng mga Manggagawa sa Libangan at Libangan

391022.title: Supervisor of Personal Service Workers
391022.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Personal Service Workers
391022.description: Supervise and coordinate activities of personal service workers.
391022.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
391022.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Trabajadores de Servicios Personales
391022.title_ja: パーソナルサービスワーカーのスーパーバイザー
391022.title_tl: Superbisor ng Mga Manggagawa sa Personal na Serbisyo

392011.title: Animal Trainer
392011.description: Train animals for riding, harness, security, performance, or obedience, or for assisting persons with disabilities. Accustom animals to human voice and contact, and condition animals to respond to commands. Train animals according to prescribed standards for show or competition. May train animals to carry pack loads or work as part of pack team.
392011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

392021.title: Animal Caretaker
392021.description: Feed, water, groom, bathe, exercise, or otherwise provide care to promote and maintain the well-being of pets and other animals that are not raised for consumption, such as dogs, cats, race horses, ornamental fish or birds, zoo animals, and mice. Work in settings such as kennels, animal shelters, zoos, circuses, and aquariums. May keep records of feedings, treatments, and animals received or discharged. May clean, disinfect, and repair cages, pens, or fish tanks.
392021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

393011.title: Gambling Dealer
393011.description: Operate table games. Stand or sit behind table and operate games of chance by dispensing the appropriate number of cards or blocks to players, or operating other gambling equipment. Distribute winnings or collect players’ money or chips. May compare the house’s hand against players’ hands.
393011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
393011.title_ja: ギャンブルディーラー

393012.title: Gambling and Sports Book Writer/Runner
393012.official_title: Gambling and Sports Book Writers and Runners
393012.description: Post information enabling patrons to wager on various races and sporting events. Assist in the operation of games such as keno and bingo. May operate random number-generating equipment and announce the numbers for patrons. Receive, verify, and record patrons’ wagers. Scan and process winning tickets presented by patrons and pay out winnings for those wagers.
393012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
393012.title_es: Receptor/Corredor de Apuestas de Juego y Deportes
393012.title_zh: 赌博和体育书籍作家/跑步者
393012.title_ja: ギャンブルとスポーツブックライター/ランナー

393019.title: Gambling Service Worker
393019.description: All gambling service workers not listed separately.
393019.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
393019.title_ja: ギャンブルサービスワーカー

393021.title: Motion Picture Projectionist
393021.description: Set up and operate motion picture projection and related sound reproduction equipment.
393021.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

393031.title: Ushers, Lobby Attendants, and Ticket Taker
393031.official_title: Ushers, Lobby Attendants, and Ticket Takers
393031.description: Assist patrons at entertainment events by performing duties, such as collecting admission tickets and passes from patrons, assisting in finding seats, searching for lost articles, and helping patrons locate such facilities as restrooms and telephones.
393031.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
393031.title_es: Acomodadores y Controladores de Boletos de Admisión
393031.title_en: Ushers, Lobby Attendants, and Ticket Taker
393031.title_zh: 接待员、大厅服务员和取票员
393031.title_ja: 案内係、ロビーアテンダント、チケット受取人
393031.title_tl: Mga User, Mga Lobby Attendant, at Ticket Taker

393091.title: Amusement/Recreation Attendant
393091.description: Perform a variety of attending duties at amusement or recreation facility. May schedule use of recreation facilities, maintain and provide equipment to participants of sporting events or recreational pursuits, or operate amusement concessions and rides.
393091.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
393091.title_es: Asistente de Establecimientos de Diversión y Recreación
393091.title_ja: アミューズメント/レクリエーションアテンダント

393092.title: Costume Attendant
393092.description: Select, fit, and take care of costumes for cast members, and aid entertainers. May assist with multiple costume changes during performances.
393092.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
393092.title_ja: コスチュームアテンダント

393093.title: Locker Room, Coatroom, or Dressing Room Attendant
393093.official_title: Locker Room, Coatroom, and Dressing Room Attendants
393093.description: Provide personal items to patrons or customers in locker rooms, dressing rooms, or coatrooms.
393093.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
393093.title_es: Asistente del Área de Armarios, Guardarropa y Vestidor
393093.title_en: Locker Room, Coatroom, or Dressing Room Attendant
393093.title_zh: 更衣室、衣帽间或更衣室服务员
393093.title_ja: ロッカールーム、コートルーム、またはドレッシングルームアテンダント
393093.title_tl: Locker Room, Coatroom, o Damit Room Attendant

393099.title: Entertainment Attendant
393099.official_title: Entertainment Attendants and Related Workers, All Other
393099.description: All entertainment attendants and related workers not listed separately.
393099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
393099.title_es: Asistente de Establecimientos de Entretenimiento y Trabajador Relacionados
393099.title_ja: エンターテイメントアテンダント

394011.title: Embalmer
394011.description: Prepare bodies for interment in conformity with legal requirements.
394011.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

394012.title: Crematory Operator
394012.description: Operate crematory equipment to reduce human or animal remains to bone fragments in accordance with state and local regulations. Duties may include preparing the body for cremation and performing general maintenance on crematory equipment. May use traditional flame-based cremation, calcination, or alkaline hydrolysis.
394012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

394021.title: Funeral Attendant
394021.description: Perform a variety of tasks during funeral, such as placing casket in parlor or chapel prior to service, arranging floral offerings or lights around casket, directing or escorting mourners, closing casket, and issuing and storing funeral equipment.
394021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

394031.title: Mortician, Undertaker, or Funeral Arranger
394031.description: Perform various tasks to arrange and direct individual funeral services, such as coordinating transportation of body to mortuary, interviewing family or other authorized person to arrange details, selecting pallbearers, aiding with the selection of officials for religious rites, and providing transportation for mourners.
394031.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
394031.title_es: Enterrador, Sepulturero, o Coordinador de Servicios Fúnebres
394031.title_zh: 殡葬者、承办人或葬礼安排人
394031.title_ja: 葬儀屋、葬儀屋、葬儀手配者

395011.title: Barber
395011.description: Provide barbering services, such as cutting, trimming, shampooing, and styling hair; trimming beards; or giving shaves.
395011.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training

395012.title: Hairdresser, Hairstylist, or Cosmetologist
395012.description: Provide beauty services, such as cutting, coloring, and styling hair, and massaging and treating scalp. May shampoo hair, apply makeup, dress wigs, remove hair, and provide nail and skincare services.
395012.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training
395012.title_es: Peluquero, Estilista de Cabello y Cosmetólogo
395012.title_zh: 美发师、发型师或美容师
395012.title_ja: 美容師、ヘアスタイリスト、美容師
395012.title_tl: Tagapag-ayos ng buhok, estilista, o kosmetologo

395091.title: Makeup Artist
395091.description: Apply makeup to performers to reflect period, setting, and situation of their role.
395091.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training
395091.title_es: Maquillador Artístico, Teatral o de Actores
395091.title_ja: メイクアップアーティスト

395092.title: Manicurist/Pedicurist
395092.description: Clean and shape customers’ fingernails and toenails. May polish or decorate nails.
395092.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training
395092.title_ja: ネイリスト／ペディクリスト

395093.title: Shampooer
395093.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

395094.title: Skincare Specialist
395094.description: Provide skincare treatments to face and body to enhance an individual’s appearance. Includes electrologists and laser hair removal specialists.
395094.typical_training: Postsecondary certificate, No work experience, No on-the-job training
395094.title_es: Especialista en Cuidados de la Piel
395094.title_ja: スキンケアスペシャリスト

396011.title: Baggage Porters or Bellhop
396011.description: Handle baggage for travelers at transportation terminals or for guests at hotels or similar establishments.
396011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
396011.title_ja: 手荷物ポーターまたはベルホップ
396011.title_tl: Mga porter ng bagahe o Bellhop

396012.title: Concierge
396012.description: Assist patrons at hotel, apartment, or office building with personal services. May take messages; arrange or give advice on transportation, business services, or entertainment; or monitor guest requests for housekeeping and maintenance.
396012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

397011.title: Tour Guide
397011.description: Escort individuals or groups on sightseeing tours or through places of interest, such as industrial establishments, public buildings, and art galleries.
397011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

397012.title: Travel Guide
397012.description: Plan, organize, and conduct long-distance travel, tours, and expeditions for individuals and groups.
397012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

399011.title: Childcare Worker
399011.description: Attend to children at schools, businesses, private households, and childcare institutions. Perform a variety of tasks, such as dressing, feeding, bathing, and overseeing play.
399011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

399031.title: Exercise Trainer or Group Fitness Instructor
399031.official_title: Exercise Trainers and Group Fitness Instructors
399031.description: Instruct or coach groups or individuals in exercise activities for the primary purpose of personal fitness. Demonstrate techniques and form, observe participants, and explain to them corrective measures necessary to improve their skills. Develop and implement individualized approaches to exercise.
399031.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
399031.title_es: Entrenador Físico o Instructor de Ejercicios en Grupo
399031.title_en: Exercise Trainer or Group Fitness Instructor
399031.title_zh: 运动教练或团体健身教练
399031.title_ja: エクササイズトレーナーまたはグループフィットネスインストラクター
399031.title_tl: Pagsasanay ng ehersisyo o Fitness Instructor ng Grupo

399032.title: Recreation Worker
399032.description: Conduct recreation activities with groups in public, private, or volunteer agencies or recreation facilities. Organize and promote activities, such as arts and crafts, sports, games, music, dramatics, social recreation, camping, and hobbies, taking into account the needs and interests of individual members.
399032.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
399032.title_ja: レクリエーションワーカー

399041.title: Residential Advisor
399041.description: Coordinate activities in resident facilities in secondary school and college dormitories, group homes, or similar establishments. Order supplies and determine need for maintenance, repairs, and furnishings. May maintain household records and assign rooms. May assist residents with problem solving or refer them to counseling resources.
399041.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
399041.title_ja: レジデンシャルアドバイザー

399099.title: Personal Care Worker
399099.official_title: Personal Care and Service Workers, All Other
399099.description: All personal care and service workers not listed separately.
399099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
399099.title_es: Trabajador de Ocupación Relacionadas con el Cuidado y Servicio Personal
399099.title_ja: パーソナルケアワーカー

411011.title: Supervisor of Retail Sales Worker
411011.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Retail Sales Workers
411011.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of retail sales workers in an establishment or department. Duties may include management functions, such as purchasing, budgeting, accounting, and personnel work, in addition to supervisory duties.
411011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
411011.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Trabajadores de Ventas Minoristas
411011.title_ja: 小売販売員スーパーバイザー

411012.title: Supervisor of Non-Retail Sales Worker
411012.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Non-Retail Sales Workers
411012.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of sales workers other than retail sales workers. May perform duties such as budgeting, accounting, and personnel work, in addition to supervisory duties.
411012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
411012.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Trabajadores de Ventas
411012.title_ja: 非小売営業労働者のスーパーバイザー

412011.title: Cashier
412011.description: Receive and disburse money in establishments other than financial institutions. May use electronic scanners, cash registers, or related equipment. May process credit or debit card transactions and validate checks.
412011.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

412012.title: Gambling Cashier
412012.official_title: Gambling Change Persons and Booth Cashiers
412012.description: Exchange coins, tokens, and chips for patrons’ money. May issue payoffs and obtain customer’s signature on receipt. May operate a booth in the slot machine area and furnish change persons with money bank at the start of the shift, or count and audit money in drawers.
412012.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
412012.title_es: Cajero de Cabina de Salas de Juego
412012.title_ja: ギャンブルキャッシャー

412021.title: Counter Clerk
412021.description: Receive orders, generally in person, for repairs, rentals, and services. May describe available options, compute cost, and accept payment.
412021.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
412021.title_es: Empleado de Mostrador y de Alquiler

412022.title: Parts Salesperson
412022.description: Sell spare and replacement parts and equipment in repair shop or parts store.
412022.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

412031.title: Retail Salesperson
412031.description: Sell merchandise, such as furniture, motor vehicles, appliances, or apparel to consumers.
412031.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

413011.title: Advertising Sales Agent
413011.description: Sell or solicit advertising space, time, or media in publications, signage, TV, radio, or Internet establishments or public spaces.
413011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

413021.title: Insurance Sales Agent
413021.description: Sell life, property, casualty, health, automotive, or other types of insurance. May refer clients to independent brokers, work as an independent broker, or be employed by an insurance company.
413021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

413031.title: Securities, Commodities, and Financial Services Sales Agent
413031.official_title: Securities, Commodities, and Financial Services Sales Agents
413031.description: Buy and sell securities or commodities in investment and trading firms, or provide financial services to businesses and individuals. May advise customers about stocks, bonds, mutual funds, commodities, and market conditions.
413031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
413031.title_es: Agente de Venta de Valores, Productos Básicos, y Servicios Financieros
413031.title_en: Securities, Commodities, and Financial Services Sales Agent
413031.title_zh: 证券、大宗商品和金融服务销售代理
413031.title_ja: 証券、コモディティ、金融サービス販売代理店
413031.title_tl: Mga mahalagang papel, Mga Kailanganin, and Sales Agent ng Serbisyo sa Pananalapi

413041.title: Travel Agent
413041.description: Plan and sell transportation and accommodations for customers. Determine destination, modes of transportation, travel dates, costs, and accommodations required. May also describe, plan, and arrange itineraries and sell tour packages. May assist in resolving clients’ travel problems.
413041.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

413091.title: Sales Representative (Services)
413091.official_title: Sales Representatives of Services, Except Advertising, Insurance, Financial Services, and Travel
413091.description: Sell services to individuals or businesses. May describe options or resolve client problems.
413091.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

414011.title: Wholesales and Manufacturing Sales Representative (Technical and Scientific Products)
414011.official_title: Sales Representatives, Wholesale and Manufacturing, Technical and Scientific Products
414011.description: Sell goods for wholesalers or manufacturers where technical or scientific knowledge is required in such areas as biology, engineering, chemistry, and electronics, normally obtained from at least 2 years of postsecondary education.
414011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
414011.title_es: Representante de Ventas Mayoristas y de Productos Manufacturados (Técnico y Científico)
414011.title_en: Wholesales and Manufacturing Sales Representative (Technical and Scientific Products)
414011.title_zh: 批发和制造销售代表（技术和科学产品）
414011.title_ja: 卸売・製造営業担当（技術・科学製品）
414011.title_tl: Kinatawan ng mga pakyawan at Manufacturing Sales (Technical at Scientific Products)

414012.title: Wholesales and Manufacturing Sales Representative (Non-Technical Products)
414012.official_title: Sales Representatives, Wholesale and Manufacturing, Except Technical and Scientific Products
414012.description: Sell goods for wholesalers or manufacturers to businesses or groups of individuals. Work requires substantial knowledge of items sold.
414012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
414012.title_es: Representante de Ventas Mayoristas y de Productos Manufacturados (Excepto de Productos Técnico y Científico)
414012.title_en: Wholesales and Manufacturing Sales Representative (Non-Technical Products)
414012.title_zh: 批发和制造销售代表（非技术产品）
414012.title_ja: 卸売・製造営業担当 (非技術製品)
414012.title_tl: Kinatawan ng mga Wholesale at Manufacturing Sales (Non-Technical Products)

419011.title: Demonstrators and Product Promoter
419011.description: Demonstrate merchandise and answer questions for the purpose of creating public interest in buying the product. May sell demonstrated merchandise.
419011.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
419011.title_ja: デモンストレーターとプロダクトプロモーター

419012.title: Model
419012.description: Model garments or other apparel and accessories for prospective buyers at fashion shows, private showings, or retail establishments. May pose for photos to be used in magazines or advertisements. May pose as subject for paintings, sculptures, and other types of artistic expression.
419012.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, No on-the-job training

419021.title: Real Estate Broker
419021.description: Operate real estate office, or work for commercial real estate firm, overseeing real estate transactions. Other duties usually include selling real estate or renting properties and arranging loans.
419021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training

419022.title: Real Estate Agent
419022.description: Rent, buy, or sell property for clients. Perform duties such as study property listings, interview prospective clients, accompany clients to property site, discuss conditions of sale, and draw up real estate contracts. Includes agents who represent buyer.
419022.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
419022.title_es: Agente de Venta de Bienes Raíces

419031.title: Sales Engineer
419031.description: Sell business goods or services, the selling of which requires a technical background equivalent to a baccalaureate degree in engineering.
419031.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

419041.title: Telemarketer
419041.description: Solicit donations or orders for goods or services over the telephone.
419041.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

419091.title: Door-to-Door Sales Worker
419091.official_title: Door-to-Door Sales Workers, News and Street Vendors, and Related Workers
419091.description: Sell goods or services door-to-door or on the street.
419091.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

419099.title: Sales Occupation
419099.official_title: Sales and Related Workers, All Other
419099.description: All sales and related workers not listed separately.
419099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, No on-the-job training

431011.title: Supervisor of Office and Administrative Support Workers
431011.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Office and Administrative Support Workers
431011.description: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of clerical and administrative support workers.
431011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
431011.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Empleados de Oficina y de Apoyo Administrativo
431011.title_en: Supervisor of Office and Administrative Support Workers
431011.title_zh: 办公室和行政支持人员主管
431011.title_ja: 事務・行政支援労働者のスーパーバイザー
431011.title_tl: Superbisor ng mga Manggagawa sa Suporta sa Opisina at Administrative

432011.title: Switchboard Operator
432011.description: Operate telephone business systems equipment or switchboards to relay incoming, outgoing, and interoffice calls. May supply information to callers and record messages.
432011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

432021.title: Telephone Operator
432021.description: Provide information by accessing alphabetical, geographical, or other directories. Assist customers with special billing requests, such as charges to a third party and credits or refunds for incorrectly dialed numbers or bad connections. May handle emergency calls and assist children or people with physical disabilities to make telephone calls.
432021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

432099.title: Communications Equipment Operator
432099.description: All communications equipment operators not listed separately.
432099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
432099.title_ja: 通信機器オペレーター

433011.title: Bill/Account Collector
433011.description: Locate and notify customers of delinquent accounts by mail, telephone, or personal visit to solicit payment. Duties include receiving payment and posting amount to customer’s account, preparing statements to credit department if customer fails to respond, initiating repossession proceedings or service disconnection, and keeping records of collection and status of accounts.
433011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
433011.title_ja: 請求/アカウントコレクター

433021.title: Billing/Posting Clerk
433021.description: Compile, compute, and record billing, accounting, statistical, and other numerical data for billing purposes. Prepare billing invoices for services rendered or for delivery or shipment of goods.
433021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

433031.title: Bookkeeping/Accounting/Auditing Clerk
433031.description: Compute, classify, and record numerical data to keep financial records complete. Perform any combination of routine calculating, posting, and verifying duties to obtain primary financial data for use in maintaining accounting records. May also check the accuracy of figures, calculations, and postings pertaining to business transactions recorded by other workers.
433031.typical_training: Some college, no degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
433031.title_es: Empleado de Teneduría de Libros, Contabilidad y Auditoría

433041.title: Gambling Cage Worker
433041.description: In a gambling establishment, conduct financial transactions for patrons. Accept patron’s credit application and verify credit references to provide check-cashing authorization or to establish house credit accounts. May reconcile daily summaries of transactions to balance books. May sell gambling chips, tokens, or tickets to patrons, or to other workers for resale to patrons. May convert gambling chips, tokens, or tickets to currency upon patron’s request. May use a cash register or computer to record transaction.
433041.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
433041.title_ja: ギャンブルケージワーカー

433051.title: Payroll/Timekeeping Clerk
433051.description: Compile and record employee time and payroll data. May compute employees’ time worked, production, and commission. May compute and post wages and deductions, or prepare paychecks.
433051.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
433051.title_es: Oficinista de Nómina o de Registro de Horas Trabajadas

433061.title: Procurement Clerk
433061.description: Compile information and records to draw up purchase orders for procurement of materials and services.
433061.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

433071.title: Teller
433071.description: Receive and pay out money. Keep records of money and negotiable instruments involved in a financial institution’s various transactions.
433071.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

433099.title: Financial Clerk
433099.description: All financial clerks not listed separately.
433099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
433099.title_es: Empleado de Oficina de Servicios Financieros

434011.title: Brokerage Clerk
434011.description: Perform duties related to the purchase, sale, or holding of securities. Duties include writing orders for stock purchases or sales, computing transfer taxes, verifying stock transactions, accepting and delivering securities, tracking stock price fluctuations, computing equity, distributing dividends, and keeping records of daily transactions and holdings.
434011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

434021.title: Correspondence Clerk
434021.description: Compose letters or electronic correspondence in reply to requests for merchandise, damage claims, credit and other information, delinquent accounts, incorrect billings, or unsatisfactory services. Duties may include gathering data to formulate reply and preparing correspondence.
434021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

434031.title: Court/Municipal/License Clerk
434031.description: Perform clerical duties for courts of law, municipalities, or governmental licensing agencies and bureaus. May prepare docket of cases to be called; secure information for judges and court; prepare draft agendas or bylaws for town or city council; answer official correspondence; keep fiscal records and accounts; issue licenses or permits; and record data, administer tests, or collect fees. Clerks of Court are classified in “Managers, All Other”.
434031.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
434031.title_es: Oficinista Judicial, Municipal o de Otorgamiento de Licencias
434031.title_ja: 裁判所/市町村/免許書記官

434041.title: Credit Authorizer/Checker/Clerk
434041.description: Authorize credit charges against customers’ accounts. Investigate history and credit standing of individuals or business establishments applying for credit. May interview applicants to obtain personal and financial data, determine credit worthiness, process applications, and notify customers of acceptance or rejection of credit.
434041.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
434041.title_es: Autorizador, Verificador o Empleado de Crédito
434041.title_zh: 信用授权人/检查员/职员
434041.title_ja: クレジットオーソライザー/チェッカー/クラーク

434051.title: Customer Service Representative
434051.description: Interact with customers to provide basic or scripted information in response to routine inquiries about products and services. May handle and resolve general complaints.
434051.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
434051.title_ja: カスタマーサービス担当者

434061.title: Eligibility Interviewer (Government Programs)
434061.description: Determine eligibility of persons applying to receive assistance from government programs and agency resources, such as welfare, unemployment benefits, social security, and public housing.
434061.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
434061.title_es: Entrevistador de Determinación de Elegibilidad para Programas del Gobierno
434061.title_ja: 適格性面接官 (政府プログラム)
434061.title_tl: Tagapanayam ng Karapatan (Mga Programa ng Pamahalaan)

434071.title: File Clerk
434071.description: File correspondence, cards, invoices, receipts, and other records in alphabetical or numerical order or according to the filing system used. Locate and remove material from file when requested.
434071.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

434081.title: Hotel, Motel, and Resort Desk Clerk
434081.official_title: Hotel, Motel, and Resort Desk Clerks
434081.description: Accommodate hotel, motel, and resort patrons by registering and assigning rooms to guests, issuing room keys or cards, transmitting and receiving messages, keeping records of occupied rooms and guests’ accounts, making and confirming reservations, and presenting statements to and collecting payments from departing guests.
434081.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
434081.title_es: Empleados de Recepción de Hotel, Motel, o Centro Turístico
434081.title_en: Hotel, Motel, and Resort Desk Clerk
434081.title_zh: 酒店、汽车旅馆和度假村服务台职员
434081.title_ja: ホテル、モーテル、それにリゾートのデスク係
434081.title_tl: Hotel, Motel, at Resort Desk Clerk

434111.title: Interviewer
434111.description: Interview persons by telephone, mail, in person, or by other means for the purpose of completing forms, applications, or questionnaires. Ask specific questions, record answers, and assist persons with completing form. May sort, classify, and file forms.
434111.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

434121.title: Library Assistant
434121.description: Compile records, and sort, shelve, issue, and receive library materials such as books, electronic media, pictures, cards, slides and microfilm. Locate library materials for loan and replace material in shelving area, stacks, or files according to identification number and title. Register patrons to permit them to borrow books, periodicals, and other library materials.
434121.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

434131.title: Loan Interviewer/Clerk
434131.description: Interview loan applicants to elicit information; investigate applicants’ backgrounds and verify references; prepare loan request papers; and forward findings, reports, and documents to appraisal department. Review loan papers to ensure completeness, and complete transactions between loan establishment, borrowers, and sellers upon approval of loan.
434131.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

434141.title: New Accounts Clerk
434141.description: Interview persons desiring to open accounts in financial institutions. Explain account services available to prospective customers and assist them in preparing applications.
434141.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
434141.title_ja: 新規アカウント担当者

434151.title: Order Clerk
434151.description: Receive and process incoming orders for materials, merchandise, classified ads, or services such as repairs, installations, or rental of facilities. Generally receives orders via mail, phone, fax, or other electronic means. Duties include informing customers of receipt, prices, shipping dates, and delays; preparing contracts; and handling complaints.
434151.typical_training: Some college, no degree, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

434161.title: Human Resources Assistant
434161.official_title: Human Resources Assistants, Except Payroll and Timekeeping
434161.description: Compile and keep personnel records. Record data for each employee, such as address, weekly earnings, absences, amount of sales or production, supervisory reports, and date of and reason for termination. May prepare reports for employment records, file employment records, or search employee files and furnish information to authorized persons.
434161.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

434171.title: Receptionist or Information Clerk
434171.description: Answer inquiries and provide information to the general public, customers, visitors, and other interested parties regarding activities conducted at establishment and location of departments, offices, and employees within the organization.
434171.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

434181.title: Ticket Agent or Travel Clerk
434181.official_title: Reservation and Transportation Ticket Agents and Travel Clerks
434181.description: Make and confirm reservations for transportation or lodging, or sell transportation tickets. May check baggage and direct passengers to designated concourse, pier, or track; deliver tickets and contact individuals and groups to inform them of package tours; or provide tourists with travel or transportation information.
434181.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
434181.title_es: Agente de Venta de Boletos de Transporte o Empleado de Oficina de Viajes
434181.title_ja: チケットエージェントまたはトラベルクラークル

434199.title: Information/Record Clerk
434199.official_title: Information and Record Clerks, All Other
434199.description: All information and record clerks not listed separately.
434199.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
434199.title_ja: 情報/レコードクラーク

435011.title: Cargo/Freight Agent
435011.description: Expedite and route movement of incoming and outgoing cargo and freight shipments in airline, train, and trucking terminals and shipping docks. Take orders from customers and arrange pickup of freight and cargo for delivery to loading platform. Prepare and examine bills of lading to determine shipping charges and tariffs.
435011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

435021.title: Courier/Messenger
435021.description: Pick up and deliver messages, documents, packages, and other items between offices or departments within an establishment or directly to other business concerns, traveling by foot, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile, or public conveyance.
435021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
435021.title_ja: クーリエ/メッセンジャー

435031.title: Public Safety Telecommunicator
435031.description: Operate telephone, radio, or other communication systems to receive and communicate requests for emergency assistance at 9-1-1 public safety answering points and emergency operations centers. Take information from the public and other sources regarding crimes, threats, disturbances, acts of terrorism, fires, medical emergencies, and other public safety matters. May coordinate and provide information to law enforcement and emergency response personnel. May access sensitive databases and other information sources as needed. May provide additional instructions to callers based on knowledge of and certification in law enforcement, fire, or emergency medical procedures.
435031.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
435031.title_ja: 公共安全テレコミュニケーター

435032.title: Dispatcher (Non-Emergency)
435032.official_title: Dispatchers, Except Police, Fire, and Ambulance
435032.description: Schedule and dispatch workers, work crews, equipment, or service vehicles for conveyance of materials, freight, or passengers, or for normal installation, service, or emergency repairs rendered outside the place of business. Duties may include using radio, telephone, or computer to transmit assignments and compiling statistics and reports on work progress.
435032.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
435032.title_ja: ディスパッチャー (非緊急)

435041.title: Utilities Meter Reader
435041.description: Read meter and record consumption of electricity, gas, water, or steam.
435041.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
435041.title_es: Lector de Medidores de Servicios Públicos
435041.title_ja: ユーティリティメーターリーダー

435051.title: Postal Service Clerk
435051.description: Perform any combination of tasks in a United States Postal Service (USPS) post office, such as receive letters and parcels; sell postage and revenue stamps, postal cards, and stamped envelopes; fill out and sell money orders; place mail in pigeon holes of mail rack or in bags; and examine mail for correct postage. Includes postal service clerks employed by USPS contractors.
435051.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

435052.title: Postal Service Mail Carrier
435052.description: Sort and deliver mail for the United States Postal Service (USPS). Deliver mail on established route by vehicle or on foot. Includes postal service mail carriers employed by USPS contractors.
435052.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
435052.title_tl: Mail Carrier ng Serbisyo ng Koreo

435053.title: Postal Service Mail Sorter/Processor
435053.official_title: Postal Service Mail Sorters, Processors, and Processing Machine Operators
435053.description: Prepare incoming and outgoing mail for distribution for the United States Postal Service (USPS). Examine, sort, and route mail. Load, operate, and occasionally adjust and repair mail processing, sorting, and canceling machinery. Keep records of shipments, pouches, and sacks, and perform other duties related to mail handling within the postal service. Includes postal service mail sorters and processors employed by USPS contractors.
435053.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
435053.title_es: Clasificadores/Procesadores de Correo del Servicio Postal
435053.title_zh: 邮政服务邮件分拣/处理器
435053.title_ja: 郵便サービス郵便分別機/処理者
435053.title_tl: Mail Sorter/Processor ng Serbisyo ng Postal

435061.title: Production/Planning/Expediting Clerk
435061.description: Coordinate and expedite the flow of work and materials within or between departments of an establishment according to production schedule. Duties include reviewing and distributing production, work, and shipment schedules; conferring with department supervisors to determine progress of work and completion dates; and compiling reports on progress of work, inventory levels, costs, and production problems.
435061.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
435061.title_es: Oficinista de Producción, Planificación, y Expedición

435071.title: Shipping/Receiving/Inventory Clerk
435071.description: Verify and maintain records on incoming and outgoing shipments involving inventory. Duties include verifying and recording incoming merchandise or material and arranging for the transportation of products. May prepare items for shipment.
435071.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
435071.title_es: Oficinista de Despacho, Recibo, e Inventario

435111.title: Recordkeeping (Weigher/Measurer/Checker/Sampler)
435111.official_title: Weighers, Measurers, Checkers, and Samplers, Recordkeeping
435111.description: Weigh, measure, and check materials, supplies, and equipment for the purpose of keeping relevant records. Duties are primarily clerical by nature. Includes workers who collect and keep record of samples of products or materials.
435111.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
435111.title_es: Controlador/Verificador de Peso, Medidas, o Muestras
435111.title_zh: 记录保存（秤/测量器/检查器/采样器）
435111.title_ja: 記録管理（計量器/計量器/チェッカー/サンプラー）

436011.title: Executive Secretary or Executive Administrative Assistant
436011.official_title: Executive Secretaries and Executive Administrative Assistants
436011.description: Provide high-level administrative support by conducting research, preparing statistical reports, and handling information requests, as well as performing routine administrative functions such as preparing correspondence, receiving visitors, arranging conference calls, and scheduling meetings. May also train and supervise lower-level clerical staff.
436011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
436011.title_es: Secretario Ejecutivo o Asistente Administrativo Ejecutivo
436011.title_en: Executive Secretary or Executive Administrative Assistant
436011.title_ja: エグゼクティブセクレタリーまたはエグゼクティブアドミニスト
436011.title_tl: Kalihim na Tagapagpaganap o Katulong na Tagapag

436012.title: Legal Secretary or Administrative Assistant
436012.description: Perform secretarial duties using legal terminology, procedures, and documents. Prepare legal papers and correspondence, such as summonses, complaints, motions, and subpoenas. May also assist with legal research.
436012.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
436012.title_ja: 法務長官または管理補佐
436012.title_tl: Legal na Kalihim o Administrative Assistant

436013.title: Medical Secretary or Administrative Assistant
436013.description: Perform secretarial duties using specific knowledge of medical terminology and hospital, clinic, or laboratory procedures. Duties may include scheduling appointments, billing patients, and compiling and recording medical charts, reports, and correspondence.
436013.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
436013.title_es: Secretario de Médico o Asistente Administrativo
436013.title_ja: 医療秘書または管理アシスタント
436013.title_tl: Kalihim ng Medikal o Administrative Assistant

436014.title: Secretary or Administrative Assistant
436014.official_title: Secretaries and Administrative Assistants, Except Legal, Medical, and Executive
436014.description: Perform routine administrative functions such as drafting correspondence, scheduling appointments, organizing and maintaining paper and electronic files, or providing information to callers.
436014.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
436014.title_ja: 秘書または管理アシスタント

439021.title: Data Entry Keyer
439021.description: Operate data entry device, such as keyboard or photo composing perforator. Duties may include verifying data and preparing materials for printing.
439021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
439021.title_es: Operador de Equipos de Ingreso de Datos

439022.title: Typist
439022.description: Use word processor, computer, or typewriter to type letters, reports, forms, or other material from rough draft, corrected copy, or voice recording. May perform other clerical duties as assigned.
439022.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

439031.title: Desktop Publisher
439031.description: Format typescript and graphic elements using computer software to produce publication-ready material.
439031.typical_training: Associate's degree, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
439031.title_ja: デスクトップパブリッシャー

439041.title: Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerk
439041.official_title: Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerks
439041.description: Process new insurance policies, modifications to existing policies, and claims forms. Obtain information from policyholders to verify the accuracy and completeness of information on claims forms, applications and related documents, and company records. Update existing policies and company records to reflect changes requested by policyholders and insurance company representatives.
439041.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
439041.title_es: Oficinista de Procesamiento de Reclamaciones y Pólizas de Seguro
439041.title_en: Insurance Claims and Policy Processing Clerk
439041.title_zh: 保险理赔和保单处理办事员
439041.title_ja: 保険金請求および保険契約処理担当者
439041.title_tl: Insurance Claims at Patakaran sa Pagproseso Clerk

439051.title: Mail Clerk or Mail Machine Operator
439051.official_title: Mail Clerks and Mail Machine Operators, Except Postal Service
439051.description: Prepare incoming and outgoing mail for distribution. Time-stamp, open, read, sort, and route incoming mail; and address, seal, stamp, fold, stuff, and affix postage to outgoing mail or packages. Duties may also include keeping necessary records and completed forms.
439051.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
439051.title_es: Empleado de Correspondencia o Operador de Máquinas de Correspondencia
439051.title_en: Mail Clerk or Mail Machine Operator
439051.title_zh: 邮件员或邮件机器操作员
439051.title_ja: 郵便局員または郵便機械オペレーター
439051.title_tl: Mail Clerk o Mail Machine Operator

439061.title: Office Clerk
439061.description: Perform duties too varied and diverse to be classified in any specific office clerical occupation, requiring knowledge of office systems and procedures. Clerical duties may be assigned in accordance with the office procedures of individual establishments and may include a combination of answering telephones, bookkeeping, typing or word processing, office machine operation, and filing.
439061.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

439071.title: Office Machine Operator
439071.description: Operate one or more of a variety of office machines, such as photocopying, photographic, and duplicating machines, or other office machines.
439071.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
439071.title_ja: オフィスマシンオペレーター

439081.title: Proofreader
439081.description: Read transcript or proof type setup to detect and mark for correction any grammatical, typographical, or compositional errors.
439081.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

439111.title: Statistical Assistant
439111.description: Compile and compute data according to statistical formulas for use in statistical studies. May perform actuarial computations and compile charts and graphs for use by actuaries. Includes actuarial clerks.
439111.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, No on-the-job training

439199.title: Office/Administrative Support Worker
439199.official_title: Office and Administrative Support Workers, All Other
439199.description: All office and administrative support workers not listed separately.
439199.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
439199.title_es: Empleado de Oficina y de Apoyo Administrativo
439199.title_ja: オフィス/管理サポートワーカー

451011.title: Supervisor of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers
451011.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers
451011.description: Directly supervise and coordinate the activities of agricultural, forestry, aquacultural, and related workers.
451011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, No on-the-job training
451011.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Trabajadores de Ocupación Relacionadas con la Agricultura, la Pesca, y la Silvicultura
451011.title_en: Supervisor of Farming, Fishing, and Forestry Workers
451011.title_zh: 农业、渔业和林业工人主管
451011.title_ja: 農業、漁業、林業従事者のスーパーバイザー
451011.title_tl: Superbisor ng mga Manggagawa sa Pagsasaka, Pangingisda, at Panggugubat

452011.title: Agricultural Inspector
452011.description: Inspect agricultural commodities, processing equipment, and facilities, and fish and logging operations, to ensure compliance with regulations and laws governing health, quality, and safety.
452011.typical_training: Bachelor's degree, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

452021.title: Animal Breeder
452021.description: Select and breed animals according to their genealogy, characteristics, and offspring. May require knowledge of artificial insemination techniques and equipment use. May involve keeping records on heats, birth intervals, or pedigree.
452021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
452021.title_ja: アニマル・ブリーダー

452041.title: Agricultural Product Grader/Sorter
452041.description: Grade, sort, or classify unprocessed food and other agricultural products by size, weight, color, or condition.
452041.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
452041.title_ja: 農産物グレーダー/ソーター

452091.title: Agricultural Operator
452091.description: Drive and control equipment to support agricultural activities such as tilling soil; planting, cultivating, and harvesting crops; feeding and herding livestock; or removing animal waste. May perform tasks such as crop baling or hay bucking. May operate stationary equipment to perform post-harvest tasks such as husking, shelling, threshing, and ginning.
452091.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

452092.title: Crop, Nursery, and Greenhouse Farmworker/Laborer
452092.official_title: Farmworkers and Laborers, Crop, Nursery, and Greenhouse
452092.description: Manually plant, cultivate, and harvest vegetables, fruits, nuts, horticultural specialties, and field crops. Use hand tools, such as shovels, trowels, hoes, tampers, pruning hooks, shears, and knives. Duties may include tilling soil and applying fertilizers; transplanting, weeding, thinning, or pruning crops; applying pesticides; or cleaning, grading, sorting, packing, and loading harvested products. May construct trellises, repair fences and farm buildings, or participate in irrigation activities.
452092.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
452092.title_es: Trabajador/Jornalero Agrícola, de Cultivos, de Viveros y de Invernaderos
452092.title_zh: 农作物、苗圃和温室农场工人/劳动者
