452092.title_ja: 作物、苗床、温室農業労働者/労働者

452093.title: Ranch, and Aquacultural Animal Farmworker
452093.official_title: Farmworkers, Farm, Ranch, and Aquacultural Animals
452093.description: Attend to live farm, ranch, open range or aquacultural animals that may include cattle, sheep, swine, goats, horses and other equines, poultry, rabbits, finfish, shellfish, and bees. Attend to animals produced for animal products, such as meat, fur, skins, feathers, eggs, milk, and honey. Duties may include feeding, watering, herding, grazing, milking, castrating, branding, de-beaking, weighing, catching, and loading animals. May maintain records on animals; examine animals to detect diseases and injuries; assist in birth deliveries; and administer medications, vaccinations, or insecticides as appropriate. May clean and maintain animal housing areas. Includes workers who shear wool from sheep and collect eggs in hatcheries.
452093.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
452093.title_es: Trabajador Agrícola de Animales de Granja, Ganado, y Animales Acuáticos
452093.title_zh: 牧场和水产养殖动物农场工人
452093.title_ja: 牧場と養殖動物農場労働者

452099.title: Agricultural Worker
452099.description: All agricultural workers not listed separately.
452099.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

453031.title: Fishing/Hunting Worker
453031.description: Hunt, trap, catch, or gather wild animals or aquatic animals and plants. May use nets, traps, or other equipment. May haul catch onto ship or other vessel. Aquacultural laborers who work on fish farms are included in “Farmworkers, Farm, Ranch, and Aquacultural Animals”.
453031.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

454011.title: Forest/Conservation Worker
454011.description: Under supervision, perform manual labor necessary to develop, maintain, or protect areas such as forests, forested areas, woodlands, wetlands, and rangelands through such activities as raising and transporting seedlings; combating insects, pests, and diseases harmful to plant life; and building structures to control water, erosion, and leaching of soil. Includes forester aides, seedling pullers, tree planters, and gatherers of nontimber forestry products such as pine straw.
454011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

454021.title: Faller
454021.description: Use axes or chainsaws to fell trees using knowledge of tree characteristics and cutting techniques to control direction of fall and minimize tree damage.
454021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

454022.title: Logging Equipment Operator
454022.description: Drive logging tractor or wheeled vehicle equipped with one or more accessories, such as bulldozer blade, frontal shear, grapple, logging arch, cable winches, hoisting rack, or crane boom, to fell tree; to skid, load, unload, or stack logs; or to pull stumps or clear brush. Includes operating stand-alone logging machines, such as log chippers. Logging truck drivers are included in “Heavy and Tractor-Trailer Truck Drivers”.
454022.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
454022.title_es: Operador de Equipo de Tala Forestal
454022.title_ja: ロギング機器オペレーター

454023.title: Log Grader/Scaler
454023.description: Grade logs or estimate the marketable content or value of logs or pulpwood in sorting yards, millpond, log deck, or similar locations. Inspect logs for defects or measure logs to determine volume.
454023.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
454023.title_es: Evaluador y Tasador de Árboles Talados
454023.title_ja: ロググレーダー/スケーラー

454029.title: Logging Worker
454029.description: All logging workers not listed separately.
454029.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

471011.title: Supervisor of Construction Trades and Extraction Workers
471011.official_title: First-Line Supervisors of Construction Trades and Extraction Workers
471011.description: Directly supervise and coordinate activities of construction or extraction workers.
471011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, 5 years or more work experience, No on-the-job training
471011.title_es: Supervisor Directo de Trabajadores de Oficios de Construcción y Extracción
471011.title_en: Supervisor of Construction Trades and Extraction Workers
471011.title_zh: 建筑行业和采掘工人主管
471011.title_ja: 建設業監督者および採掘作業員
471011.title_tl: Superbisor ng Mga Trades ng Konstruksiyon at Mga Manggagawa sa Pagkuha

472011.title: Boilermaker
472011.description: Construct, assemble, maintain, and repair stationary steam boilers and boiler house auxiliaries. Align structures or plate sections to assemble boiler frame tanks or vats, following blueprints. Work involves use of hand and power tools, plumb bobs, levels, wedges, dogs, or turnbuckles. Assist in testing assembled vessels. Direct cleaning of boilers and boiler furnaces. Inspect and repair boiler fittings, such as safety valves, regulators, automatic-control mechanisms, water columns, and auxiliary machines.
472011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship

472021.title: Brickmason/Blockmason
472021.description: Lay and bind building materials, such as brick, structural tile, concrete block, cinder block, glass block, and terra-cotta block, with mortar and other substances, to construct or repair walls, partitions, arches, sewers, and other structures. Installers of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units are classified in “Landscaping and Groundskeeping Workers”.
472021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship
472021.title_ja: ブリックメイソン/ブロックメイソン

472022.title: Stonemason
472022.description: Build stone structures, such as piers, walls, and abutments. Lay walks, curbstones, or special types of masonry for vats, tanks, and floors.
472022.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship

472031.title: Carpenter
472031.description: Construct, erect, install, or repair structures and fixtures made of wood and comparable materials, such as concrete forms; building frameworks, including partitions, joists, studding, and rafters; and wood stairways, window and door frames, and hardwood floors. May also install cabinets, siding, drywall, and batt or roll insulation. Includes brattice builders who build doors or brattices (ventilation walls or partitions) in underground passageways.
472031.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship

472041.title: Carpet Installer
472041.description: Lay and install carpet from rolls or blocks on floors. Install padding and trim flooring materials.
472041.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
472041.title_ja: カーペットインストーラー

472042.title: Floor Layer
472042.official_title: Floor Layers, Except Carpet, Wood, and Hard Tiles
472042.description: Apply blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing, sound-deadening, or decorative coverings to floors.
472042.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
472042.title_es: Instalador de Pisos, Excepto Alfombras, Pisos de Madera y Losas

472043.title: Floor Sander/Finisher
472043.description: Scrape and sand wooden floors to smooth surfaces using floor scraper and floor sanding machine, and apply coats of finish.
472043.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
472043.title_ja: フロアサンダー/フィニッシャー

472044.title: Tile and Stone Setter
472044.description: Apply hard tile, stone, and comparable materials to walls, floors, ceilings, countertops, and roof decks.
472044.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
472044.title_ja: タイルとストーンセッター

472051.title: Cement Mason or Concrete Finisher
472051.description: Smooth and finish surfaces of poured concrete, such as floors, walks, sidewalks, roads, or curbs using a variety of hand and power tools. Align forms for sidewalks, curbs, or gutters; patch voids; and use saws to cut expansion joints. Installers of mortarless segmental concrete masonry wall units are classified in “Landscaping and Groundskeeping Workers”.
472051.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
472051.title_es: Albañil de Trabajos en Cemento o Terminador de Concreto
472051.title_zh: 水泥泥瓦匠或混凝土修整器
472051.title_ja: セメントメイソンまたはコンクリートフィニッシャー
472051.title_tl: Latagan ng simento Mason o Concrete Finisher

472053.title: Terrazzo Worker/Finisher
472053.description: Apply a mixture of cement, sand, pigment, or marble chips to floors, stairways, and cabinet fixtures to fashion durable and decorative surfaces.
472053.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship
472053.title_es: Trabajador de Aplicación o Terminación de Terrazo
472053.title_ja: テラゾワーカー/フィニッシャー

472061.title: Construction Laborer
472061.description: Perform tasks involving physical labor at construction sites. May operate hand and power tools of all types: air hammers, earth tampers, cement mixers, small mechanical hoists, surveying and measuring equipment, and a variety of other equipment and instruments. May clean and prepare sites, dig trenches, set braces to support the sides of excavations, erect scaffolding, and clean up rubble, debris, and other waste materials. May assist other craft workers. Construction laborers who primarily assist a particular craft worker are classified under “Helpers, Construction Trades”.
472061.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

472071.title: Paving/Surfacing/Tamping Equipment Operator
472071.official_title: Paving, Surfacing, and Tamping Equipment Operators
472071.description: Operate equipment used for applying concrete, asphalt, or other materials to road beds, parking lots, or airport runways and taxiways or for tamping gravel, dirt, or other materials. Includes concrete and asphalt paving machine operators, form tampers, tamping machine operators, and stone spreader operators.
472071.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
472071.title_es: Operador de Equipos de Pavimentación, Aplanamiento o Compactación
472071.title_zh: 铺路/铺面/夯实设备操作员
472071.title_ja: 舗装/表面処理/タンピング設備オペレーター

472072.title: Pile Driver Operator
472072.description: Operate pile drivers mounted on skids, barges, crawler treads, or locomotive cranes to drive pilings for retaining walls, bulkheads, and foundations of structures such as buildings, bridges, and piers.
472072.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
472072.title_ja: パイルドライバーオペレーター

472073.title: Operating Engineer or Construction Equipment Operator
472073.official_title: Operating Engineers and Other Construction Equipment Operators
472073.description: Operate one or several types of power construction equipment, such as motor graders, bulldozers, scrapers, compressors, pumps, derricks, shovels, tractors, or front-end loaders to excavate, move, and grade earth, erect structures, or pour concrete or other hard surface pavement. May repair and maintain equipment in addition to other duties.
472073.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
472073.title_es: Operador Mecánico u Operador de Equipo Pesado
472073.title_en: Operating Engineer or Construction Equipment Operator
472073.title_zh: 运营工程师或建筑设备操作员
472073.title_ja: 運用エンジニアまたは建設機械オペレーター
472073.title_tl: Operating Inhinyero o Operator ng Kagamitang

472081.title: Drywall and Ceiling Tile Installer
472081.description: Apply plasterboard or other wallboard to ceilings or interior walls of buildings. Apply or mount acoustical tiles or blocks, strips, or sheets of shock-absorbing materials to ceilings and walls of buildings to reduce or reflect sound. Materials may be of decorative quality. Includes lathers who fasten wooden, metal, or rockboard lath to walls, ceilings, or partitions of buildings to provide support base for plaster, fireproofing, or acoustical material.
472081.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
472081.title_es: Instalador de Paneles de Yeso y Paneles Acústicos de Techo
472081.title_zh: 石膏板和天花板瓷砖安装商
472081.title_ja: 乾式壁と天井タイルのインストーラー

472082.title: Taper
472082.description: Seal joints between plasterboard or other wallboard to prepare wall surface for painting or papering.
472082.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

472111.title: Electrician
472111.description: Install, maintain, and repair electrical wiring, equipment, and fixtures. Ensure that work is in accordance with relevant codes. May install or service street lights, intercom systems, or electrical control systems.
472111.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship

472121.title: Glazier
472121.description: Install glass in windows, skylights, store fronts, and display cases, or on surfaces, such as building fronts, interior walls, ceilings, and tabletops.
472121.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship

472131.title: Insulation Worker (Floor, Ceiling, and Walls)
472131.official_title: Insulation Workers, Floor, Ceiling, and Wall
472131.description: Line and cover structures with insulating materials. May work with batt, roll, or blown insulation materials.
472131.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
472131.title_es: Trabajador de Instalación de Pisos, Techos y Paredes Aislantes
472131.title_zh: 绝缘工人（地板、天花板和墙壁）
472131.title_tl: Pagkakabukod Worker (Sahig, Kisame, at Mga Pader)

472132.title: Insulation Worker (Mechanical)
472132.description: Apply insulating materials to pipes or ductwork, or other mechanical systems in order to help control and maintain temperature.
472132.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship

472141.title: Painter (Construction and Maintenance)
472141.description: Paint walls, equipment, buildings, bridges, and other structural surfaces, using brushes, rollers, and spray guns. May remove old paint to prepare surface prior to painting. May mix colors or oils to obtain desired color or consistency.
472141.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
472141.title_ja: 塗装工業 (建設・メンテナンス)

472142.title: Paperhanger
472142.description: Cover interior walls or ceilings of rooms with decorative wallpaper or fabric, or attach advertising posters on surfaces such as walls and billboards. May remove old materials or prepare surfaces to be papered.
472142.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training

472151.title: Pipelayer
472151.description: Lay pipe for storm or sanitation sewers, drains, and water mains. Perform any combination of the following tasks: grade trenches or culverts, position pipe, or seal joints.
472151.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

472152.title: Plumber/Pipefitter/Steamfitter
472152.description: Assemble, install, alter, and repair pipelines or pipe systems that carry water, steam, air, or other liquids or gases. May install heating and cooling equipment and mechanical control systems. Includes sprinkler fitters.
472152.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship
472152.title_es: Plomero, Instalador o Ajustador de Tuberías de Agua y de Vapor
472152.title_ja: 配管工/パイプフィッター/スチームフィッター

472161.title: Plasterer or Stucco Mason
472161.description: Apply interior or exterior plaster, cement, stucco, or similar materials. May also set ornamental plaster.
472161.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
472161.title_ja: 左官またはスタッコ・メイソン

472171.title: Reinforcing Iron and Rebar Worker
472171.description: Position and secure steel bars or mesh in concrete forms in order to reinforce concrete. Use a variety of fasteners, rod-bending machines, blowtorches, and hand tools. Includes rod busters.
472171.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship
472171.title_es: Trabajador de Colocación de Refuerzos de Hierro y Varillas
472171.title_tl: Pagpapalakas ng Iron at Rebar Worker

472181.title: Roofer
472181.description: Cover roofs of structures with shingles, slate, asphalt, aluminum, wood, or related materials. May spray roofs, sidings, and walls with material to bind, seal, insulate, or soundproof sections of structures.
472181.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

472211.title: Sheet Metal Worker
472211.description: Fabricate, assemble, install, and repair sheet metal products and equipment, such as ducts, control boxes, drainpipes, and furnace casings. Work may involve any of the following: setting up and operating fabricating machines to cut, bend, and straighten sheet metal; shaping metal over anvils, blocks, or forms using hammer; operating soldering and welding equipment to join sheet metal parts; or inspecting, assembling, and smoothing seams and joints of burred surfaces. Includes sheet metal duct installers who install prefabricated sheet metal ducts used for heating, air conditioning, or other purposes.
472211.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship

472221.title: Structural Iron and Steel Worker
472221.description: Raise, place, and unite iron or steel girders, columns, and other structural members to form completed structures or structural frameworks. May erect metal storage tanks and assemble prefabricated metal buildings.
472221.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship
472221.title_es: Trabajador de Piezas de Hierro y Acero Estructural

472231.title: Solar Photovoltaic Installer
472231.description: Assemble, install, or maintain solar photovoltaic (PV) systems on roofs or other structures in compliance with site assessment and schematics. May include measuring, cutting, assembling, and bolting structural framing and solar modules. May perform minor electrical work such as current checks.
472231.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
472231.title_ja: 太陽光発電インストーラ

473011.title: Helper (Brickmason, Blockmason, Stonemason, or Tile/Marble Setter)
473011.official_title: Helpers--Brickmasons, Blockmasons, Stonemasons, and Tile and Marble Setters
473011.description: Help brickmasons, blockmasons, stonemasons, or tile and marble setters by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist brickmasons, blockmasons, and stonemasons or tile and marble setters are classified under “Construction Laborers” (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
473011.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
473011.title_es: Ayudante de Albañiles de Ladrillos, Bloques y Piedras o Instalador de Losas y Mármol
473011.title_en: Helper (Brickmason, Blockmason, Stonemason, or Tile/Marble Setter)
473011.title_zh: 助手（Brickmason、Blockmason、Stonemason 或瓷砖/大理石二传手）
473011.title_ja: ヘルパー (ブリックメイソン、ブロックメイソン、ストーンメイソン、または大理石セッター)
473011.title_tl: Helper (Brickmason, Blockmason, Stonemason, o Marble Setter)

473012.title: Helper (Carpenter)
473012.description: Help carpenters by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist carpenters are classified under “Construction Laborers” (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
473012.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
473012.title_ja: ヘルパー (カーペンター)

473013.title: Helper (Electrician)
473013.description: Help electricians by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist electricians are classified under “Construction Laborers” (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
473013.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

473014.title: Helper (Painter, Paperhanger, Plasterer, or Stucco Mason)
473014.official_title: Helpers--Painters, Paperhangers, Plasterers, and Stucco Masons
473014.description: Help painters, paperhangers, plasterers, or stucco masons by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist painters, paperhangers, plasterers, or stucco masons are classified under “Construction Laborers” (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
473014.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
473014.title_es: Ayudante de Pintores, Empapeladores, Yeseros y Estucadores
473014.title_en: Helper (Painter, Paperhanger, Plasterer, or Stucco Mason)
473014.title_zh: 助手（画家、Paperhanger、石膏工或灰泥泥工）
473014.title_ja: ヘルパー (画家、ペーパーハンガー、左官、スタッコメイソン)
473014.title_tl: Helper (Painter, Paperhanger, Plasterer, o Stucco Mason)

473015.title: Helper (Pipelayer, Plumber, Pipefitter, or Steamfitter)
473015.description: Help plumbers, pipefitters, steamfitters, or pipelayers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist plumbers, pipefitters, steamfitters, or pipelayers are classified under “Construction Laborers” (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
473015.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
473015.title_es: Ayudante de Instalador de Tuberías, Plomero/Instalador/Ajustador de Tuberías de Agua y de Vapor
473015.title_zh: 助手（管道工、水管工、管道工或 Steamfitter）
473015.title_ja: ヘルパー (パイプレイヤー、配管工、パイプフィッター、スチームフィッター)

473016.title: Helper (Roofer)
473016.description: Help roofers by performing duties requiring less skill. Duties include using, supplying, or holding materials or tools, and cleaning work area and equipment. Construction laborers who do not primarily assist roofers are classified under “Construction Laborers” (47-2061). Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
473016.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

473019.title: Helper (Construction Trades)
473019.description: All construction trades helpers not listed separately.
473019.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
473019.title_es: Ayudante de Oficios de la Construcción

474011.title: Construction/Building Inspector
474011.description: Inspect structures using engineering skills to determine structural soundness and compliance with specifications, building codes, and other regulations. Inspections may be general in nature or may be limited to a specific area, such as electrical systems or plumbing.
474011.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, 5 years or more work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

474021.title: Elevator and Escalator Installer/Repairer
474021.official_title: Elevator and Escalator Installers and Repairers
474021.description: Assemble, install, repair, or maintain electric or hydraulic freight or passenger elevators, escalators, or dumbwaiters.
474021.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, Apprenticeship
474021.title_es: Instalador y Reparadores de Ascensores y Escaleras Mecánicas
474021.title_zh: 电梯和自动扶梯安装人员/维修人员
474021.title_ja: エレベーターとエスカレーターの設置者/修理業者

474031.title: Fence Erector
474031.description: Erect and repair fences and fence gates, using hand and power tools.
474031.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
474031.title_ja: フェンス・エレクター

474041.title: Hazardous Materials Removal Worker
474041.description: Identify, remove, pack, transport, or dispose of hazardous materials, including asbestos, lead-based paint, waste oil, fuel, transmission fluid, radioactive materials, or contaminated soil. Specialized training and certification in hazardous materials handling or a confined entry permit are generally required. May operate earth-moving equipment or trucks.
474041.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
474041.title_es: Trabajador de Remoción de Materiales Peligrosos
474041.title_zh: 危险物质清除工作人员
474041.title_tl: Mapanganib na Materyales sa Pag-alis ng Manggagawa

474051.title: Highway Maintenance Worker
474051.description: Maintain highways, municipal and rural roads, airport runways, and rights-of-way. Duties include patching broken or eroded pavement and repairing guard rails, highway markers, and snow fences. May also mow or clear brush from along road, or plow snow from roadway.
474051.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

474061.title: Rail-Track Laying and Maintenance Equipment Operator
474061.official_title: Rail-Track Laying and Maintenance Equipment Operators
474061.description: Lay, repair, and maintain track for standard or narrow-gauge railroad equipment used in regular railroad service or in plant yards, quarries, sand and gravel pits, and mines. Includes ballast cleaning machine operators and railroad bed tamping machine operators.
474061.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
474061.title_es: Instalador de Rieles y Operador de Equipo de Mantenimiento de Rieles
474061.title_en: Rail-Track Laying and Maintenance Equipment Operator
474061.title_zh: 轨道铺设和维护设备操作员
474061.title_ja: 線路敷設および保守機器オペレーター
474061.title_tl: Operator ng Kagamitan at Pagpapanatili ng Rail-Track

474071.title: Septic Tank Servicer/Sewer Pipe Cleaner
474071.official_title: Septic Tank Servicers and Sewer Pipe Cleaners
474071.description: Clean and repair septic tanks, sewer lines, or drains. May patch walls and partitions of tank, replace damaged drain tile, or repair breaks in underground piping.
474071.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
474071.title_es: Operador de Servicio de Tanques Sépticos o Limpiador de Cañerías Cloacales
474071.title_zh: 化粪池服务/下水道管道清洁剂
474071.title_ja: 浄化槽サービサー/下水管クリーナー

474091.title: Segmental Paver
474091.description: Lay out, cut, and place segmental paving units. Includes installers of bedding and restraining materials for the paving units.
474091.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

474099.title: Construction Worker
474099.official_title: Construction and Related Workers, All Other
474099.description: All construction and related workers not listed separately.
474099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

475011.title: Oil/Gas Derrick Operator
475011.description: Rig derrick equipment and operate pumps to circulate mud or fluid through drill hole.
475011.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training
475011.title_zh: 石油/天然气井架操作员
475011.title_ja: 石油/ガスデリック・オペレーター

475012.title: Oil/Gas Rotary Drill Operator
475012.official_title: Rotary Drill Operators, Oil and Gas
475012.description: Set up or operate a variety of drills to remove underground oil and gas, or remove core samples for testing during oil and gas exploration.
475012.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
475012.title_zh: 石油/天然气旋挖机操作员
475012.title_ja: 石油/ガスロータリードリルオペレーター

475013.title: Oil/Gas Service Unit Operator
475013.official_title: Service Unit Operators, Oil and Gas
475013.description: Operate equipment to increase oil flow from producing wells or to remove stuck pipe, casing, tools, or other obstructions from drilling wells. Includes fishing-tool technicians.
475013.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
475013.title_zh: 石油/天然气服务单位运营商
475013.title_ja: 石油・ガスサービスユニットオペレーター
475013.title_tl: Operator ng Yunit ng Serbisyo ng Langis

475022.title: Excavating and Loading Machine and Dragline Operator
475022.official_title: Excavating and Loading Machine and Dragline Operators, Surface Mining
475022.description: Operate or tend machinery at surface mining site, equipped with scoops, shovels, or buckets to excavate and load loose materials.
475022.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
475022.title_es: Operador de Excavadora, Cargadora y Draga de Línea de Baldes
475022.title_en: Excavating and Loading Machine and Dragline Operator
475022.title_zh: 挖掘和装载机和吊斗铲操作员
475022.title_ja: 機械とドラグラインオペレーターの掘削と積み込み
475022.title_tl: Paghuhukay at Paglo-load ng Machine at Dragline Operator

475023.title: Oil/Gas Earth Driller
475023.official_title: Earth Drillers, Except Oil and Gas
475023.description: Operate a variety of drills such as rotary, churn, and pneumatic to tap subsurface water and salt deposits, to remove core samples during mineral exploration or soil testing, and to facilitate the use of explosives in mining or construction. Includes horizontal and earth boring machine operators.
475023.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
475023.title_zh: 石油/天然气地球钻探员
475023.title_ja: 石油/ガスアースドリラー

475032.title: Explosives Worker, Ordnance Handling Expert
475032.official_title: Explosives Workers, Ordnance Handling Experts, and Blasters
475032.description: Place and detonate explosives to demolish structures or to loosen, remove, or displace earth, rock, or other materials. May perform specialized handling, storage, and accounting procedures.
475032.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, Less than 5 years work experience, More than 1 year on-the-job training
475032.title_es: Trabajador de Explosivos, Expertos en el Manejo de Artillería y Dinamiteros
475032.title_zh: 爆炸物工人、军械处理专家
475032.title_ja: 爆発物作業員、兵器処理エキスパート

475044.typical_training: No formal educational credential, No work experience, Less than 1 month on-the-job training

475044.title_ja: 機械オペレーターの積み込みと移動
475044.title_tl: Naglo-load at Paglipat ng Operator Machine

475049.title: Underground Mining Machine Operator
475049.official_title: Underground Mining Machine Operators, All Other
475049.description: All underground mining machine operators not listed separately.
475049.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
475049.title_es: Operador de Máquinas de Minería Subterránea
475049.title_ja: 地下鉱山機械オペレーター
475049.title_tl: Operator ng Pagmimina sa ilalim ng lupa

475051.title: Rock Splitter
475051.description: Separate blocks of rough dimension stone from quarry mass using jackhammers, wedges, or chop saws.

475071.description: Assemble or repair oil field equipment using hand and power tools. Perform other tasks as needed.

Duties include supplying equipment or cleaning work area. Apprentice workers are classified with the appropriate skilled construction trade occupation (47-2011 through 47-2231).
475081.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training

475099.title: Extraction Worker
475099.description: All extraction workers not listed separately.
475099.typical_training: High school diploma or equivalent, No work experience, 1 to 12 months on-the-job training
475099.title_es: Trabajador de Ocupación Relacionadas con la Extracción
